She will use the loan to buy more goods to sell at her shop, including clean water by the sack, rice, and drinks.  In the future, she would like to own a house.  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, including clean water by the sack, rice, and drinks

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su hijo de 25 años de edad, sus nietos de 10 y 15 años de edad. Ella, se dedica a la venta de antojitos, tales como: yuca frita, papitas, pasteles, entre otros; actividad que la realiza los días sábados y domingos.
El préstamo que solicita le permitir comprar materia prima, como lo es: yuca, papas, ollas grandes, aceite, condimentos, harina, leña, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio y para cancelar una pequeña deuda.
Su sueño es construir una casa de bloque y que sus nietos estudien para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her 25 year old son and 10 and 15 year old grandchildren. She makes a living selling snacks including fried cassava, potatoes, and meat pastries. She carries out this work on Saturdays and Sundays. 

The loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy supplies including cassava, potatoes, oil, flour, condiments, large pots, and firewood. This investment will help her strengthen her business and pay a small debt. Her dreams are to build her own home of cement blocks and for her children to study to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy cassava, potatoes, flour, condiments, oil, large pots, firewood, and other items.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es: Albertina nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo, vive junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 30 años de edad, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es ser profesora, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para uso personal como para la educación de sus hijos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Albertina was born in the city of Paucartambo and lives with her family in this city. She is 30 years old and is a hard working and entrepreneurial person who moves her family forward with the efforts of her hard work. Her main job is as a teacher. She is a responsible person which is why she was invited to participate in the "Camino al Progreso" (Path to Progress) Communal Bank. With this opportunity she needs a loan for personal use to cover the education of her children. She appreciates and values the loan and promises to fulfill the monthly loan installments responsibly.

loans.use: to cover her children's education.

loans.name: Mariamma Group

texts.en:
Somulamma lives in the small village of J.K.Pur in the district of Rayagada, Odisha, India. She is a head-strong and confident lady. She hails from a poor family of Below Poverty Line. The lady standing third from left in the photo raising her hand is Somulamma. She is 38 years of age and lives with her only son aged about 17 years and her husband. 

Somulamma has had a fish business for the last five years. She purchases fish from wholesalers @Rs.70 to Rs.80/- per Kg. and sells it in nearby villages @Rs.100 to Rs.110/- per Kg. She earns about Rs.3,000 per month and her family income is about Rs.6,000 p.m.

According to Somulamma this amount is not at all sufficient for her to manage the household expenditures. So she wants to expand her business to earn some extra income.

This will be the first loan for the group from Mahashakti Foundation. Out of the other three members of the group, Radha and Bijayalaxmi are doing grocery businesses and Paibatali is doing a milk business.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet is 53 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is still in school. For her entire family, the pig-raising business is the only source of income, which she has been involved in for 10 years. 

This is the seventh loan for Yet with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful past loans which she has fully repaid, she was able to improve her lifestyle better than before. Now, in a group of three, she is a leader. The total amount of her group loan is 1,800,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pig feed and pigs for raising. 

She hopes that she can make more income so she can buy a plot of land to build a new house for her family, as well as to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and pigs for raising

loans.name: Song's Group

texts.en:
Aged 60 and a local farmer from Battambang province where rice cropping is the most popular crop in the area, Song is a mother of four children. Two hectares of rice farming has returned her almost 39,000 KHR per day; it is the business that she has been involved with for 15 years. 

This is the first loan for Song’s group with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The total amount of her entire group's loan is 1,400,000 KHR, of which 500,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and herbicide for her crops. 

She hopes that she can make more income to better her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and herbicide for her crops

loans.name: Red Rose Group

texts.en:
Rabeninsia, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has been running a general store since the year 2000.  She works from 6:00 am to 1:00 am (after mid-night) per working day and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to expand the retail shop until it is now a really big shop.  She started selling cold drinks in the same shop and other different items like mosquito sprays, cigarettes, soaps etc.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to build her own house, paid school fees and helped her husband with household expenses.She will use this loan to restock the missing items in the shop inventory. She dreams of opening a hardware shop.

Rabeninsia will share this loan with her loan group "Red Rose" which consist of 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in the shop inventory.

loans.name: Muhabbatjon

texts.ru: Мухаббатчону 19 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка, которому 3 месяца. Она отлично училась в средней школе и после окончания средней школы она не смогла поступить в университет, так как она вышла замуж. Теперь после рождения ребенка, она посоветовалась с мужем и поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Мухаббатчон будет учиться по специальности юриста. Она умная и трудолюбивая женщина и надеется, что будет учиться отлично. Мухаббатчон должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет возможности, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и не отправил ей деньги. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhabbatjon is 19 and married with a three-month-old baby. She was an excellent high school student but after graduation was unable to attend university because she had gotten married. Now, after the birth of her child, she and her husband agreed she would apply to the Tajik State University of Politics and Business, where she will major in law. She is an intelligent and hardworking woman and hopes to do well in her studies. Muhabbatjon needs to pay her tuition but cannot because her husband is a migrant worker in Russia and has not sent her the money. She is requesting a loan for her tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides, among other things

loans.name: Neelam's Group

texts.en:
Neelam is a borrower of BRAC Pakistan and group leader of this two person group. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She has two sons. Her husband owns a general store and that is how he fulfills the family needs. He sells a variety of products like flour, detergent, milk, pulses [beans, nuts, peas], soaps, shampoo, rice, noodles, etc. 

Currently, the stock of his shop is almost gone and he does not have enough savings to purchase more products. As this business is the only source of income for his family, it is therefore necessary to continue this work. That is why his wife, Neelam, has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to purchase a variety of products to sell in his general store. He will purchase flour, detergent, milk, pulses, soaps, and shampoo with the Kiva loan.

The loan amount would be very helpful to continue his business. Neelam wants to thank Kiva field partners and all staff of BRAC Pakistan for their kind help.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products to sell in the general store.

loans.name: Ruom's Group

texts.en:
Ruom, 41, is a villager from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is a mother of nine children. Nowadays, she caters to only four kids, as three of them are in school and one is too young for schooling. 

In her household, the family’s income is from her pig-raising business and her husband’s occupation as a blacksmith. Now, she is short of working capital to buy pig feed for her business. Therefore, she leads a group of two borrowers to get a new loan from VisionFund. Ruom is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva‘s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans with success to better support her living and keep her kids in school. 

Now, Ruom and her co-borrower are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pig feed for her business. She hopes that she can fatten her pigs in a healthy condition so that she can double her income and keep her kids in school.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for her business.

loans.name: Kimhon's Group

texts.en:
Kimhon is 31 years old and a mother of two little kids in school. To strive for a living, she and her husband work for others for a fee. She has been involved in the current business for five years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Kimhon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy two pigs for raising for extra income. She hopes that she can raise her pigs healthily so that she can get a good income to keep her kids in school, as well as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy two pigs for raising for extra income.

loans.name: Samon's Group

texts.en:
Samon is from Moung Russey district, Battambang province. She is married and a mother of two children, who are in school. Her main source of income is rice farming, on a five-hectare area of land. This is the business that she has engaged in for around 20 years, and it has returned her about 28,000 KHR per day.

Samon, in her fourth loan cycle, forms a group of two borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her previous loans, which she used wisely to better her living standard. Now, she and her fellow borrower are seeking to borrow 1,400,000 KHR, each. As the leader, Samon will spend her loan portion to buy five sacks of fertilizer and to pay the fee for plowing her farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop and make double income.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of fertilizer and to pay the fee for plowing her land

loans.name: Nimol's Group

texts.en:
Nimal is a mother of four kids and lives in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. Nimol is a breadwinner in the family. She strives for a living via a grocery-selling business, which she has been involved with for ten years. 

Nimol has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past six cycles and has fully repaid the past loan with success already. The past loan enabled her to support her grocery business in a timely manner and earn a decent income to keep her kids in school. 

Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale, such as canned food, instant noodles, food ingredients, etc. She hopes this purchase will replenish her business on time and return her a good income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata est âgée de 56 ans,  mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle réside avec  son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier  Kouloukoro de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Elle a prématurément abandonné les études, ainsi elle a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle mène plusieurs activités telle que : l’achat-vente du bois de chauffage, le savon artisanal, les petits condiments, etc.  Mme est une cliente de Soro depuis plus de 8 ans, elle a pris des prêts en groupe (prêt solidaires), elle est à son 7ème prêt  individuel, et tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Aminata envisage utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat des produits divers pour les stocker : sacs de Fakoye, de bissap et de savons traditionnels. Elle effectue sa vente  devant sa porte  à une clientèle mixte au comptant. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 50 000 FCFA par mois, qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro, contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes  de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Aminata is 56, married and the mother of six children. She lives with her husband and her children in the district of Kouloukoro, prefecture of Koutiala, (Sikasso region). She left school prematurely so she took up money-earning activities more than 15 years ago.   She has engaged in various activities such as buying and selling firewood, homemade soap, condiments, etc. She has been a client of Soro Yiriwaso for more than eight years. She took out group (solidarity) loans and now she is on her seventh individual loan, with all the preceding loans correctly reimbursed. 

Aminata intends to use this loan to buy various items to stock: sacks of "fakoye" and "bissap" (hibiscus flowers) and traditional soap. She makes her sales in front of her door, for cash, to a mixed clientele. With this loan she expects to make a profit of 50,000 f CFA per month, which she will use to reimburse the interest charged by Soro Yiriwaso, contribute to the daily expenditures of her family, and invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various articles for resale.

loans.name: Phanna's Group

texts.en:
Phanna is 35 years old and a resident of Thmor Koul district, Battambang province. She and her husband cultivate rice, in order to put food on their table and support their six dependent children. The current business has returned her about 38,000 KHR per day.

This is the eighth loan for Phanna and her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Phanna's previous loans enabled her to timely support her agribusiness and to improve her livelihood with good progress. For this loan cycle, she is seeking 200,000 KHR, and her fellow group member is applying for 300,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a good yield and make double income to sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farmland

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo, vive junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 53 años de edad, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de frutas  y verduras, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Manuela was born in the city of Paucartambo, where she lives with her family. She is a 53-year-old, hardworking, and enterprising woman. Manuela works very hard in her business selling fruits and vegetables in order to help her family get ahead.  She is a very responsible person. For this reason, she was invited to participate in the communal bank "Path to Progress". In this moment, Manuela requires this loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables. She is very grateful for and values this loan. Manuela pledges to responsibly make all of her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo, vive junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 62  años de edad, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, papa, tomates y otras cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Paulina was born in the city of Paucartambo.  She lives with her family in the same city.  She is 62 years old.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who gets her family ahead with the effort she puts into her work.  Her main source of income is selling vegetables, such as carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, and others.  She is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the Camino al Progreso Communal Bank.  She currently needs a loan to buy vegetables.  She is thankful for and appreciates the loan and she promises to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona honesta y trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus hijas y nietos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa usada desde hace 5 años.
Doña María sale a vender de manera ambulante en los distintos barrios y colonias cercanos a su comunidad. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como ser: pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas, shorts, vestidos, etc. 
Doña María espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a el contara con las prendas necesarias para satisfacer los pedidos y necesidades de los clientes además espera que sus ventas aumenten y gracias a esto poder mejorar un poco su estilo de vida y la de su familia.
Doña María espera aumentar su negocio y de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia y cumplir las metas y sueños de los mismos para que vivan de una mejor manera. 



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
María is an honest and hardworking person who lives in a community in southern Honduras with her daughters and grandchildren.  She has had a used clothing business for five years.

María sells on foot in different neighborhoods and areas close to her community.  She needs a loan to buy more raw material, such as pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, shorts, dresses, etc.

María expects the loan to help her greatly because thanks to it she will have the garments she needs to meet the requests and needs of her customers.  She also expects her sales to increase, which will allow her to improve her and her family's lifestyle a little.

María hopes to expand her business, which will allow her to keep supporting her family and make their goals and dreams come true so they can live better.  



Choluteca, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, shorts, dresses, etc. for her business

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
Sareth, a mother of four children in her early 40s, is a local farmer who strives for a living via rice cropping on three hectares area, and working as a schoolteacher in the area. She has been involved in the current business for 10 years. 

With this loan, she and her co-borrowers in the same group of three are fourth-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely to uplift her livelihood. Now, all of the members, including her, are taking out a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and to pay for labor costs. 

She hopes that she can gain double the yield from her crops and earn a better income than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Gladis Antonia

texts.es: Gladis nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 42  años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es ser profesora, ella trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de Paucartambo pero también tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azucar, fideos y otras cosas mas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Gladis, 42, was born in the city of Paucartambo, where she lives with her family.  She has one child from her common-law marriage.  She's a hardworking and enterprising woman who gets her family ahead with the effort she puts into her job.

Gladis's main job is teaching.  She works in one of the schools in the city of Paucartambo.  She also has a grocery store in her home.  She was invited to join Llapallanchis Llankasunchis Communal Bank because she's a responsible person.

She needs this loan to buy more rice, sugar, pasta, and other merchandise.

Gladis is grateful for and appreciates the loan, and she promises to make her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, pasta, and other merchandise

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, vive con su familia, su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 7, 9 y 10 años, no posee familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica a la agricultura, cultivo de maíz y pepino, dicha actividad la aprendió de sus padres y lo realiza desde hace 15 años, lo desempeña todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm  y hasta el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá o servirá para la compra de insumos agrícolas, tales como: herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, abono, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir los materiales agrícolas para el cultivo de pepino y maíz, con las ganancias poder ofrecerle ayuda a su familia.
El sueño del Sr. Víctor es construir una nueva casa y brindarles apoyo a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Víctor lives with his family: his life partner and their three children, who are 7, 9, and 10 years old.  He does not have family abroad.  He farms for a living, growing corn and cucumbers.  He learned this business from his parents and he has been working in it for 15 years.  He works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. and he has not had any problems.  

The loan he is asking for will allow him to buy farming supplies, such as herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and fertilizer, among others.  This investment will help him get farming materials for his cucumber and corn crops.  He will be able to help his family with his earnings.  

Víctor's dream is to build a new home and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and fertilizer, among other things

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines, is 47 years old and happily married to Anacleto, who works as a welder. God has blessed them with four loving children. Life is indeed hard, but by the grace of God they were able to raise their children well, and they are helping each other in working for their family.


Luzviminda owns a variety store, a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community; such stores are usually connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other items. She gets her products from a wholesaler which she then sells per piece at a profit. She also has a small food stall for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby and the people in the community. Luzviminda earns Php1500 a day.


To be able to expand her inventory, Luzviminda is requesting a Php 30,000.00 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her in adding more products to her store.


Luzviminda hopes that her business will continue to grow bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.


All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Savat's Group

texts.en:
Savat is 50 years old and a father of four children. He lives in Thmor Koul district, of Battambang province. His main sources of income are a pig-raising business and a rice-selling business. He has been involved in the current business for 20 years.

Savat has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for eight loan cycles, including this one. He has fully repaid his past seven loans, and he used them with success, to upgrade his living conditions. Now, he leads a group of three people to get a new loan.  He and one of his co-borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each, while the remaining member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, Savat will spend his loan portion to buy pig feed, with which to fatten his pigs. He hopes to raise his pigs healthily, so he will get a good price for them when he sells.

loans.use: To buy pig feed, with which to fatten his pigs

loans.name: Rakhimakhon

texts.ru: Рахимахон 48 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Рахимахон имеет среднее образование. Соседи отзываются о ней как о старательной и ответственной женщине. Супруг -мелкий предприниматель, сын и старшая дочь находятся на заработках в России, материально поддерживают родителей, ежемесячно высылая им деньги. Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. Рахимахон в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Опыт в разведении и содержании скота очень большой. Благодаря упорному труду Рахимахон в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 6 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,30 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, подсолнух и кукурузу. Ее сельхоздеятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Рахимахон вырастить и обустроить детей, а также улучшить уровень жизни. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рахимахон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Рахимахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена сделать ремонт дома, в котором проживает вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en:
Rakhimakhon is 48 and married with four children. She has a high school education. Her neighbours speak of her as a diligent and responsible woman. Her husband is a small businessman and her son and older daughter are working in Russia and send money to support their parents every month. Rakhimakhon's husband and children actively help around the house and farm. Her family is very friendly and they have very good relationships with each other.

Since 2000, Rakhimakhon has been raising livestock and crops as the main source of income for her family, a business she began with 5,000 KGS. She has great experience raising and keeping cattle. Thanks to her hard work, her farm now includes two milking cows and six sheep, as well as 0.3 hectares of agricultural land on which she is growing potatoes, sunflowers and corn. Her agricultural work brings in about 10,000 KGS per month, which serves as the primary source of payment for her family's groceries and other everyday needs. The profits from her farm have allowed Rakhimakhon to bring up and provide for her children, and to improve their standard of living. 

With the goal of further developing her farm, Rakhimakhon has turned to microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase cows. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further enlargement of her property as well as, in the future, to renovate the house in which she and her family live.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, él tiene 49 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, él es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos químicos como por ejemplo fertilizantes y semillas, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar más fertilizantes, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Feliciano, 49, was born in the city of Paucartambo, where he lives with his family.  He has four children from his common-law relationship.  He's a hardworking and enterprising person who gets his family ahead with the effort he puts into his work.

Feliciano's main job is selling chemical products such as fertilizer and seeds.  He was invited to join Llapallanchis Llankasunchis Communal Bank because he's a responsible person.

He needs this loan to buy more fertilizer.

Feliciano's grateful for and appreciates the loan, and he promises to make his monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: El Kuychy Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL KUYCHY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Sebastian, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maura ella es conviviente y tiene 33 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,uvas,platanos y mandarinas, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas y verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas,platanos,uvas,cebollas,zanahorias y pepinos.
El socio que esta tapado con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal El Kuychy.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de huevos, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanía.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank group “EL KUYCHY”, located in the district of San Sebastian, of the Anta province and department of Cusco.

Maura lives with her partner. She is 33 years old and has a son. She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables such as apples, oranges, grapes, plantains, mandarine oranges, carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Maura works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. She has been in this business for seven years and it has gone very well for her. Maura's dream is to have her own shop from which to sell her fruits and vegetables. She is requesting this loan in order to buy oranges, plantains, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers. 

The person with the circle covering his face no longer is a member of the El Kuychy group.
 
The other members of this group run businesses selling eggs, animals, groceries, and handicrafts.

She is grateful to everyone who has a part in her dream through this loan and she pledges to make all of her repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy oranges, plantains, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  KOROBARAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme FATOUMATA debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 90.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Benkadi I group are married women, who on average are 42 years old, have six children and live in polygamous families in Korobarage, one of the villages of Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, having paid back their previous loans in full. Their crop is corn with Ms. Fatoumata standing in the first position from the left to the right of the photo. With this loan, she expects to buy plowing, seeds, and fertilizers to maintain .5. The output is sold at the village level in Sikasso after the harvest to a customer base made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 90,000 francs CFA by farming. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase plowing, inputs and agricultural seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOROBARAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme  SALIMATA debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 95.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Benkadi II group are married women, who on average are 42 years old, have six children and live in polygamous families in Korobarage, one of the villages of Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, having paid back their previous loans in full. Their crop is corn with Ms. Salimata standing in the first position from the left to the right of the photo. With this loan, she expects to buy plowing, seeds, and fertilizers to maintain .5. The output is sold at the village level in Sikasso after the harvest to a customer base made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 95,000 francs CFA by farming. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase plowing, inputs and agricultural seeds.

loans.name: Dildora

texts.ru: Дилдора кредитуется первый цикл. Она добросовестная и трудолюбивая девушка. Дилдора родилась в сельской местности в семье простого рабочего. Её отец трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Её мать работает учительницей в средней школе. Она в 2002 году пошла в первый класс. Дилдора в школе училась хорошо, активно участвовала в общественных мероприятиях школы и в 2013 учебном году успешно окончила 11 класс.  В том же году она поступила на первый курс Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции на очное отделение по договорной основе. Дилдора с детства мечтала стать экономистом и служить на благо своего народа. Но кроме зарплаты матери и отца у них нет другого источника дохода, чтобы оплатить договор. Поэтому она обратилась в ИМОН с целью получения кредита для оплаты суммы договора. Дилдора надеется на Вашу финансовую поддержку и хочет получить высшее образование.
texts.en:
Dildora is taking a loan for the first time. She is a conscientious and hardworking girl. Dildora was born in a village, in a family of ordinary workers. Her father is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Her mother works as a high school teacher. 

In 2002, Dildora started school. She studied well, participated actively in the social activities at the school, and in the school year of 2013 she successfully finished year 11. In this same year, she entered the Tajik State University of Commerce. She studies full time, and she has to pay to study. 

Since childhood, Dildora dreamed of becoming an economist and serve for the benefit of her people. But apart from her mother and father's salary they don't have other sources of income, in order to pay for the studies. Therefore, she turned to IMON with an aim to get a loan for paying her tuition. Dildora hopes for your financial support and would like to get a higher education.

loans.use: To pay for education at the university

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOROBARAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme MAH debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Benkadi III group are married women, who on average are 42 years old, have six children and live in polygamous families in Korobarage, one of the villages of Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, having paid back their previous loans in full. Their crop is corn with Ms. Mah standing in the second position from the left to the right of the photo. With this loan, she expects to buy plowing, seeds, and fertilizers to maintain .5. The output is sold at the village level in Sikasso after the harvest to a customer base made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 50,000 francs CFA by farming. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase plowing, inputs and agricultural seeds.

loans.name: Sayha

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Сайха является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж имеет маленький доход. Сайха решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Difficult living conditions forces a person to focus all their efforts and summon their resources. Sayha is one of these people who try to improve living conditions and stimulate the financial situation of the family. She is married and raising four children. Her husband has a small income. 

Sayha decided to help her husband for the benefit of the family. With this aim she attended the training "To Get Ahead", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. Currently she may set up her own business and become successful in this area. She would like to set up a business of animal sales, as she has experience in this type of business. She plans to use the income from the loan to provide her children with a good education and nutritious food. 

Sayha requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni for the purchase of livestock in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for setting up a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул 42 года, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывает 4 детей. У Назгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Назгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, а также 4 лошади, ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки жеребят. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 42 years old, married, and she is raising four children together with her husband. Nazgul has secondary education. 

As a main income for her family, Nazgul works with livestock breeding, after having started 20 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nazgul's persistent work, her farm currently counts one dairy cow and four horses, and the monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Nazgul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for increasing the number of livestock through purchasing foals. Nazgul plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock, and plans to save money for repairing the old livestock barn.

loans.use: to purchase foals

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chantha is 46 years old and married. She is blessed with five children, four of whom still count on her, as some of them are in school and some are too young for schooling. Her main sources of income are from a fruit plantation and a recycled items trading business.  She has been engaged in her current business for ten years, earning about 28,900 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Chantha is a fourth-time borrower and leads a group of four to get a new loan. The past loans, which she has fully repaid, have enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a good pace. 

Chantha will spend her loan portion to buy recycled items for resale and to buy a cart to transport her recycled items. She hopes this purchase will support her business on time so that she can gain a good income to keep improving her living.

loans.use: to buy recycled items for resale.

loans.name: Mclaren Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her mid 40s, is single with two children, a boy and a girl who are enrolled in school. For twenty years now, Hadija has been running two businesses, a mamalishe (restaurant), offering different food services, and also a poultry business using local chickens which she grows herself. Hadija sells these chickens in two forms: chicks and big chickens. She works from 5:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. daily and is able to earn a good profit per working day. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Hadija's first loan request. She will use the loan to buy chicken food and mamalishe food cooking items (charcoal, cooking oil, maize flour, baking flour, etc.). She dreams that one day, she will be able to build a café. 

Hadija will share this loan with her loan group, “Mclaren", which consist of ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicken food and mamalishe food cooking items (charcoal, cooking oil, maize flour, baking flour, etc.).

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en: Ty is 33 years old and a mother of three children who are in school. To support her family, she grows garlic as her core business with support from her husband. Engaging in her current business for 15 years, she has been able to earn up to 20,800 KHR per day. Ty is a second time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), forming a group of two to get a new loan. Her past loans has enabled her to improve her living condition better than before and provide the primary basic needs for her family. Now, she is seeking for 1,000,000 KHR; it is the same loan amount of her co-borrower. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash, rice seed, and gasoline for her hand-tractor. She hopes that she can gain a good crop output and make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy potash, rice seed, and gasoline for her hand-tractor

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en: Chreb is 35 years old and married. She is a resident from Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She has three children, but only two children under her dependency. To overcome her family’s hardship, she does rice cropping. She has involved in her current business for 10 years, earning about 16,400 KHR per day. This is second time for Cherb to lend from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and the first cycle for the other two borrowers in the same group. Her original loan has enabled her to support her agribusiness timely to improve her lifestyle and she has fully repaid back her past loan already. Now, the total amount of her entire group loan is 1,900,000 KHR, which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy six sacks of fertilizer for her crops and to buy pigs plus its feed for her pig-raising business, a new business to supplement her income. She hopes that she can make more income to buy a small rice mill to support her crops and expand her pig-raising business.

loans.use: To buy six sacks of fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en: A villager from Sangke district of Battambang province, Vorn is 32 years old and blessed with three dependent children. She generates income via rice cropping with the support from her husband who uses spare time to catch fish for resale. This business has returned her about 16,700 KHR per day.  This is the second microloan for Vorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has succeeded in repaying her past loan wisely and to upgrade her lifestyle at a good pace and to expand her business in a gradual pace. Now, in a group of three, she is a leader. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can make more yields from her crops and get a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Amani-Hondogo Group

texts.en:
Jackson is in his early 30s and is married with three children who are still going to school. He has been running a business of transporting clients by using a motorcycle. He has been in this business for five years now. He works from 3.00am (at night) to 10.00 am daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Jackson's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to maintain the motorcycle by taking it for servicing and to buy  spares which were out of service. He has paid all his loans successfully. He used his profit to build his own house and to pay his children's school fees.  He will use this loan to buy his own motorcycle. Previously he was employed. His dream is to one day be able to own a spare parts shop, buy a water tank and start selling water.

Jackson will share this loan with his loan group "Amani-Hondogo" with nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para el fortalecimiento del negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar faja, discos, entre otros para que el molino se encuentre en buenas condiciones y asi ofrecerle un mejor servicio a los clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos y obtuvo más clientes satisfechos. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado en gran medida.
texts.en:
Rafael needs to opt for a new loan to strengthen his business; this investment will help him to buy a belt, disks, and other items to ensure that the mill is in good condition and thus offer a better service to his customers. 

The previous loan helped him to improve his income and he obtained more satisfied customers. His financial conditions and family circumstances have improved to a great degree.

loans.use: to buy a belt and disks, among other items.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is an honest lady. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan and a responsible mother of four children. She  belongs to a poor family, and fulfills the family's needs despite so many challenges. 

Her husband is a cobbler.  He has a small shop in the cornor of the street market. He provides shoe making services in her community. He is a very hardworking and happy person.  Balqees has requested a Kiva loan to help her husband in purchasing rexine, leather and thread for mending shoes. She prays for the growth of her husband's work, as this is the only source of income for the family. She hopes that the loan amount will be helpful for her husband's work. 

She wants to provide a good education to her children, but because of lack of finances, she is unable to send her children to school. She is thankful to Kiva and the BRAC staff for their help.

loans.use: to purchase rexine, leather and thread for mending shoes.

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en: Rath, originally from Sang district of Battambang province, is 33 years old and a married mother blessed with seven children. The main sources of her family’s income are from paddy rice farming and a small income from her husband job as motor-taxi driver.  With this new loan, she is the second-time borrower and her co-borrower is the third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully repaid back, enabled her to support her business and uplift her lifestyle in a good pace. Now, she and her fellow group member are seeking for 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for plowing fee and labor cost. She hopes that she can gain a good yield and gain more income to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for plowing fee and labor cost

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is a 34-year-old married father of two children. He has been working as a barber for 10 years. In 2008, he opened his own barber shop, and he developed it in a well-managed way. He dreams to renovate his barber shop and equip a salon with new equipment. 

Vusal is requesting a loan hardwood floors, vacuum insulated windows, wallpaper, paint, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate his old apartment. In this way Vusal hopes to improve the security and well-being of his family. By doing so his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where energy is preserved efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass.

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A mother of five children residing in the Sampov Meas Ddistrict of Pursat Province, Yoeurn is 55 years old and a local farmer who plants rice, peanuts, and maize. This business, which she has had for 20 years, has returned her about 19,500 KHR per day. 

Now, Yoeurn is a leader of a group consisting of  four female members. She and  two other borrowers are the in their fifth loan cycle, whilst a remaining borrower is a second time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  She has fully repaid her past loan with success in stabilizing her business on a good path. Now, the total amount of her entire group loan is 5,400,000 KHR.

Yoeurn, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, will spend her loan portion to buy 15 sacks of fertilizer to support her business. She hopes to boost her crop yield timely and get a good income so that she can start up a small grocery store to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of fertilizer to support her business.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Mollepata Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE MOLLEPATA II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Mollepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zonia ella es soltera y tiene 38 años y tiene 2hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado que es una tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

La socia que esta tapada su cara con un circulo ya no pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer de Mollepata ii
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de ganados, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanía.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The communal bank "NUEVO AMANECER DE MOLLEPATA II" is located in the district of Mollepata which belongs to the province of Anta in the department of Cusco.

Zonia, one of the members, is 38 years old, single and has two children.  She has a grocery stand in the market and sells staples such a rice, sugar, milk and oil.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and has been in business for a year, and things are going well for her.  Her goal is to expand the business.  She is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The member whose face is whited out no longer belongs to the communal bank.  The other members are involved in livestock farming, animal sales, grocery and crafts businesses.

The borrower is grateful to the lenders and committed to paying the loan back on time.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Khan, 47, is local farmer from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. For her entire family, six hectares of rice farming and half hectare of bean planting are the main sources of income. It is the business that she has had for ages. Khan, a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has fully repaid back her past loans wisely to sustain her business at a gradually pace. Now, she is seeking for a new loan of 2,500,000 KHR in order to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and rice seed for her crops. She hopes to double her crop yield and get a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crops

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng, 33, is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school and one still at home. The family lives in a village in Battambang province. For the past ten years Eng has farmed rice on six hectares of land.

This will be the second microloan for Eng through VisionFund, a Kiva partner. Her past loan has improved her life, especially in terms of keeping her children in school. This loan of 4,000,000 KHR will be used to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for labor costs for her farmland. A portion of the loan will also be spent on buying piglets to raise and sell.

Eng hopes to triple the yield from her crops and so make more money. With it she can keep her children in school up to college level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Khorl's Group

texts.en: Khorl is 34 years old and married. She is a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang where she plants her rice in order to support her family especially her three dependent kids. Besides this agribusiness, she also raises pigs for resale for additional income. This is the business that she has had for 10 years, earning about 27,900 KHR per day. This is not the first-time loan for Khorl with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back loan wisely to uplift her lifestyle in a good pace. Now, in a group of four, she is a leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor cost. She hopes to gain a good yield from cash-crop and gain a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 42 años, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 26, 23, 19 y 15 años con quienes vive en su casa propia. Gloria se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco por las mañanas. Su labor empieza por las madrugadas dirigiéndose al puerto pesquero de su localidad a comprar su mercadería directamente de los pescadores mayoristas, luego los lleva a su puesto de ventas ubicado en un mercado muy concurrido. Se inició hace más de 3 años con un capital propio y viendo que era un trabajo fácil de realizar y de mucha demanda, decidió dedicarse completamente a desarrollarla y desde entonces ha mantenido constante su inversión inicial. Antes de iniciar su negocio, tenía problemas económicos ya que  se había separado del padre de sus hijos y con la necesidad de tener un ingreso económico decidió a empezar a vender. Viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, espera  ver crecer su negocio, aumentando su capital. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con sus planes, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará pescado al por mayor.
texts.en:
Gloria, 42, is a single mother and has four children, ages 26, 23, 19 and 15, who live with her in her own house.  She sells fresh fish for a living and her work day begins in the early hours in her town's fishing port.  She buys fish directly from the wholesale fishermen, and then sells it at her stand in the busy market.  Over three years ago she started her business with her own money; and seeing that it was an easy job with considerable demand, she decided to work full time developing her business.  Since then she has maintained her initial investment.

Before starting her business she had economic problems after divorcing her children's father and needed to earn an income.  Since she earns a good profit she wants to expand and increase her capital.  She is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN and is grateful for the opportunity of receiving financial support to develop her plan.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  The loan will be used to buy fish wholesale.

loans.use: To buy fish wholesale.

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.ru: Абубакр родился в 1995 года. Он воспитанный и добродушный молодой человек. В семье у них 6 человек. Он не женат. Абубакр в этом году окончил среднюю школу. Он учился в школе отлично и участвовал во всех мероприятиях школы. Абубакр после окончания школы поступил в Государственный Технологический Университет по специальности Мировой маркетинг. Он будет учиться на английском языке. Абубакр  должен оплатить за учебный договор. Его отец трудовой мигрант, а мать работает учительницей в средней школе. Они не в состоянии оплатить за учебный договор Абубакра. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abubakr was born in 1995.  He is a well-mannered and kind young man.  There are six people in his family.  He is not married.  Abubakr graduated from a secondary school this year.  He studied excellently in school and participated in all school events.  After finishing school, Abubakr was accepted to the State Technology University with a world marketing major.  He will be studying in English.  Abubakr has to pay for his university tuition.  His father is a migrant worker, and mother works as a teacher a secondary school.  They cannot pay for his tuition.  Abubakr is requesting this loan to pay for his university tuition.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: El Gorrion Group

texts.es:
El señor Marciano es casado, de edad 35 años, de escolaridad primaria completa, tiene 3 hijos y los 3 estan estudiando, se dedica a la siembr de cardamomo, inició este negocio desde niño ayudando a sus padres en la diembra de cardamomo y hasta la fecha lleva 26 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la limpieza de cardamomo, desea en el futuro contar con mas cuerdas de terreno para poder sembrar cardamomo. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedicana a la siembra de cardamomo. En la fotografia aparecen 14 integrantes pero solo a 13 de ellos se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Marciano is married, is 35 years old, completed primary school and has three children, all of whom are studying. He makes a living by planting cardamom. He began working in this business as a child, helping his parents plant cardamom, and he has 26 years of experience so far. He also has the support of his wife.

Marciano has organized a group asking for a loan that will be utilized for cleaning cardamom. In the future he wants to have more acres of land to be able to plant cardamom. The other members of the group also make a living from planting cardamom. There are 14 members in the photograph but the loan was only given to 13 of them.

loans.use: to clean cardamom

loans.name: Dora Concepcion

texts.es:
Dora, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en el negocio de su tienda y para ofrecerle mayores productos a los clientes; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar productos de la canasta básica, tales como: frijoles, aceite, huevo, azúcar, condimentos, detergentes, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias ha podido  aportar a su familia, las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares  han mejorado.
texts.en:
Dora is in need of a new loan to use as work capital for her grocery store, as she wants to offer her customers more products.  This investment will help her buy staples such as beans, oil, eggs, sugar, condiments, detergents, etc.

She used the previous loan to strengthen her business.  Her profits have gone to the family so the household economic conditions have improved.

loans.use: To buy beans, oil, eggs, sugar, condiments, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Chou's Group

texts.en:
Chou, originally from the Sangke district of Battambang province, is sixty years old and a widower. He is a rice farmer who works hard to make a living for the sake of his family, especially his five children. He has farmed for the past ten years and when averaged, earns about 19,800 KHR per day.

Chou is new to VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. He is now forming a group of two to apply for a 1,000,000 KHR loan that will be divided between them. Chou will use his portion of the loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. He hopes to gain a better yield than last year and so improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock her shop with more drinks and buy new equipment for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan vive en la ciudad de chincha, e sun joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando en la universidad la carrera de Computación e informática, y para poder solventar sus gastos de estudios trabaja como chofer de una mototaxi, cada día Jonathan trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente y por las noches el va a su centro de estudios.

Jonathan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le ha brindado el podrá realizar el mantenimiento de su vehículo, con lo cual podrá conducir en buenas condiciones y seguir trabajando para poder solventar sus estudios, ya que es su única fuente de ingresos, asi seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Jonathan lives in the city of Chincha.  He's a young man with a great desire to get ahead, so he's putting a lot of effort into his university program in computer science and information technology.

Jonathan drives a motorcycle taxi to pay for his studies.  He works about eight hours a day and can serve up to fifteen customers.  He goes to school at night.

Jonathan's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

This way he can have good driving conditions and continue working to pay for his studies with his only source of income.  He'll continue striving to make his biggest dream come true: to finish school and have his own house.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Saoda's Group

texts.en: Saoda is a young mother of little kids. She tackles her daily cost of living via rice farming whereas her husband works for others for a fee during his spare time. This is the first loan for Saoda's group with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before, and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Luz 51 Group

texts.es: Luz 51 es un grupo solidario que esta comenzando con su crédito. Esta integrado por 10 mujeres muy responsables que se conocen desde hace 7 años. Rosa es una persona de 56 años, casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, son casados y trabajan. Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales por pedido y el crédito la ayudará a invertir en materia prima para poder hacer mayor cantidad de pedidos. Ella quiere salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz 51 is a solidarity group that's beginning its loan cycle.  It's made up of ten very responsible women who have known each other for seven years.

Rosa, 56, is married and has five children, all of them married adults who work.  She makes a living selling tamales on order.

The loan will help Rosa invest in ingredients to be able to fill more orders.  She wants to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for tamales

loans.name: Perla Massiel

texts.es:
Perla Massiel, es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios universitarios, esta es su historia: Me llamo  Perla Massiel, tengo 18 años  de edad vivo en Licey –Santiago con mis padres, nací en Santiago, tengo dos hermanos más pequeños  siendo yo la mayor.
Mi padre trabaja como herrero  y mi madre en un centro de internet familiar, estudio el tercer ciclo de la carrera de medicina  en Utesa- Santiago, desde niña soñé con esta carrera, en mis juegos infantiles  yo siempre era la doctora y lo hacía con tanto entusiasmo que esa inspiración  me motivo a que mi bachillerato lo hiciera técnico en enfermería, como preámbulo a lo que hoy estudio.
También  he visto  la necesidad  de personas que mueren a mi alrededor  porque no tienen el dinero para pagar una clínica,  pero cuando yo me gradué   quiero apoyar a mi comunidad  y aportar a  mi región con mis conocimientos,  pero solo con la ayuda del programa kiva puedo lograrlo.
texts.en:
Perla Massiel is an 18-year-old medical student. She is applying for a loan so she can pay for her university studies. This is her story:

My name is  Perla Massiel. I'm 18 and live in Licey -Santiago with my parents. I was born in Santiago, have two younger brothers, and am the oldest child. 

My father works as a blacksmith and my mother works in a family internet center. I'm in the third semester of the medial program in Utesa- Santiago. I've dreamed of being a doctor since I was a a young girl. Playing with other children, I was always the doctor, and my enthusiasm for that role has remained an inspiration. It was my motivation to earn a bachelor's degree as a nurse technician in preparation for my medical studies.   

I've also seen the needs of people who have died around me because they lack money to pay for medical care. When I graduate, I want to support my community and make a contribution to the larger region through my knowledge and experience. But I can only do this with the support of Kiva's loan program.

loans.use: To pay university tuition.

loans.name: Samun's Group

texts.en: Samun, 63, is a married father of five children residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He has five children. To deal with the daily cost of living, he does rice cropping and pineapple planting. To help the family generate more income, his wife sells dessert after helping him on the rice farm. He has been involved in his current business for ages, earning about 20,000 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Samun’s group, composed of three members, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). His past loans, which he has fully repaid, have enabled him to upgrade his living at a good pace. Now he and his co-borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes that he can gain a good yield from his crop and make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Wallen

texts.en: Wallen is a thirty-year-old divorced man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For a year now he has been in the agricultural business and he also operates a retail shop in order to meet his daily family expenses. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children, construct a permanent residential house, and venture into produce sales so as to raise more income for the family. Wallen intends to use the loan to buy coffee, maize and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee, maize and rice to sell.

loans.name: Monhzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Monhzul is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a 'ger', a traditional nomadic yurt, in Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband Enhbold works with his brother on a construction site, and her son Chimeddorj studies at local school. Daughter Anudari is 5 and goes to local kindergarten. 

Monhzul has been running a shoe retail business at a rental counter of the local market for more than a decade and has a lot of experience in the business. She imports shoes from Erlian, China, sells them at her counter, and pleases her regular customers with her tastefully chosen pairs of shoes. She is now requesting loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of shoes from Erlian, China to sell at her counter in the market. She is hardworking, welcoming and a positive woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of shoes from Erlian, China to sell at her counter in the market

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is married with three children who are in school. She is 37 years old and lives in Tambisan, San Juan, Siquijor. She sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste and soft drinks. She has been a PMPC member for one year. In the future, Analyn hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste and soft drinks.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is single and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  Angie owns and operates a service-based business providing passenger services, which she has done for  years to make a living. Aside from this, she also runs her piggery, raising pigs for sale. Angie successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC that she used for her motorcycle renewal. Recently, she borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy piglets and livestock feed.

 In the future, Angie hopes to purchase an additional motorcycle and add another business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and livestock feed.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora is a widow with five children who lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For years, she has owned and operated a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell to earn a living. She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2009 and successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used to improve her farm. Recently, she  is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her farm in order to gain an abundant harvest in return. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee and maize to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is widowed with 8 children. Myrna is 52 years old and lives in Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.  

Myrna has a grocery store to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to pay for gallons of cooking oil, sacks of sugar, and assorted candies.

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Myrna hopes to have another business which is to buy and sell RTW (ready-to-wear clothing).

loans.use: to pay for gallons of cooking oil, sacks of sugar, and assorted candies.

loans.name: Hiyam Group

texts.en:
Hiyam is a group of three Lebanese women. They acquired a loan from Kiva partner's Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. 

Hiyam is the featured borrower of the group; she is the lady wearing red in the middle. Hiyam is a 56-year-old married mother of five children. She puts in so much effort to develop her business in order to provide better for her family's increasing needs.

Hiyam is a makeup artist.  She works from her house because at the beginning she wasn't financially capable of opening a separate place of business of her own. She specializes in tattoo and makeup work.  Her clients are increasing because of her special reputation and expertise after ten years in this field.

Today, Hiyam is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner's Al Majmoua to open a new shop selling clothes.  She will invest in a well-managed way in both businesses to develop them equally.

As for the other group members, Samia is the lady in blue at the left, and Joumana is the lady at the right.

loans.use: To open a new shop selling clothes

loans.name: Consorcio La Semilla Ii Group

texts.es:
El socio Mario pertenece al banco comunal CONSORCIO LA SEMILLA II, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Mario tiene 54 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casado, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su carrera de guía oficial de turismo, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su profesión el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio realiza diversos tours como Machupicchu, City Tours, Vallé Sagrado entre otros, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de boletos turísticos.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.

Los demas socios son profesionales en odontologia,enfermeros,restauradores y guias de turismo.
EL socio agradece a los inversionistas de Kiva y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Mario belongs to the "CONSORCIO LA SEMILLA II" communal bank which is located in Cusco district, in the Department and Province of the same name. Mario is 54 years old is married and has three children. He alternates his daily activities working as an official Tourist guide. He has been doing this for a long time now. He does well, thanks to the great effort he puts in daily. He organizes various tours such as Machupicchu, Cusco City Tours, Sacred Valley tours, etc. Mario is a hardworking and responsible person and it is through this that he can get his family ahead.
