Mario is requesting this loan to buy tourist tickets (entrance to various attractions in the Cusco/Sacred Valley area). Mario is grateful to the lenders at Kiva and promises to honor his installment repayments.

The other members include dentists, nurses, restaurant owners and tour guides. The members who appear in the small attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of their work.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets. (entrance to various attractions in the Cusco/Sacred Valley area)

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 38 años de edad, está casada con Richard quien es empleado y padre de sus 03 hermosos hijos de 17, 12 y 03 años de edad respectivamente. Actualmente está embarazada de su último bebé. Vive junto a toda su familia en su casa propia. Isabel se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños para todo tipo de acontecimiento. Realiza su trabajo desde su casa propia y es muy solicitada por los vecinos de la zona en la que vive principalmente por sus amigos y familiares ya que tiene un trato agradable cuando atiende a sus clientes. Realiza este trabajo desde hace 07 años y en todo este tiempo logró ser reconocida entre sus clientes quienes compran sus productos de manera continua. Por otro lado, comenta que se inició en éste negocio por el deseo de contar con un ingreso propio, sentirse independiente y no depender de los ingresos de su esposo, así como el poder apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, comenta estar agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para concretar sus planes, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de su mercadería como polos, blusas, prendas interiores, camisas y pantalones de diversas tallas y modelos para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Isabel, 38, is married to Richard who is employed and the father of her three beautiful children (17, 12, and 3 years old). Currently, she is pregnant with their fourth child. She lives with her family in their own house. 

Isabel earns a living by selling clothes for women, men, and children, for all occasions. She works from home and is sought after in the area where she lives, mostly by friends and family, and as a result, has pleasant interactions with her customers. She has been selling clothes for seven years and has a good reputation among clients who purchase from her regularly. Isabel says that she started this business in order to have her own income, to be independent, and to not have to rely on her husband's income, as well as to help him with household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan of S/.800, and says that she is grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit to carry out her plans, and she is committed to repaying her loan on time. She will use the entire loan to purchase merchandise such as polo shirts, blouses, undergarments, shirts, and pants, in various sizes and styles for women, men, and children.

loans.use: to buy blouses, polo shirts, pants, and other items for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 53 years old and lives in Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines.   She is married, with six children. 

Jessie works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to  pay for more fishing materials. 

Jessie has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, she hopes someday to have professional children.

loans.use: to pay for fishing materials.

loans.name: Mangadalena

texts.en:
Mangadalena is a 29-year-old married woman living in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been selling salt for twelve years, and she buys directly from the salt miners at the lake.  Salt's corrosive nature and limited funds affect her business growth, while her dream is to process the salt herself so as to add value and attract a higher price. 

Mangadalena intends to use the loan to buy salt to sell.   She also desires to educate her children up to the university.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married, with two children, and she  lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, with her family.  Her husband works as a private employee while she sells barbeque to make a living. She has been doing this for years to support the needs of her family. 

In 2012, she joined Gata Daku MPC, and she has successfully repaid her previous loans that she used to improve her living. She borrowed a new loan recently to buy raw ingredients and materials for barbeque vending. 

She is thankful to GDMPC for giving her access to micro-finance services.  That has enabled her to improve her ability to engage in business and also to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and materials for barbeque vending

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 30 years old and married, with two children, who are six and two years old.  The family lives in a rural setting.

Andrew is a farmer who raises passion fruit and cabbages. He has been in this business for three years. He started it with the aim of improving his family's standard of living through selling these goods.

He has acquired this loan in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his cabbage and passion fruit plantations. He usually sells his products to local traders in villages.  His hope is to have a large plantation that can yield large volumes such that he can sell to the city traders.

His main challenge is dry seasons, which tend to hurt his crops.  He describes himself as a hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his passion fruit and cabbages

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is 62 years old and lives in Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is married with nine children. 

Dionesio has a bamboo weaving business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to pay for bamboo trees.

Dionesio is just a new member of PMPC. In the future, he hopes to have more savings for his family's future.

loans.use: to pay for bamboo trees.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 27 years old and lives in Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is still single. 

Danilo works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan to pay for fishing materials.

Danilo has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, he hopes to have enough savings to acquire another pump boat to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fishing materials.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina, 48, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Armando, a security guard, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also sells fruits for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marina hopes to have a big grocery store someday and dreams of a good future for her children.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man aged forty years with six children. He lives on the outskirts of Kyotera town with his family. His children are seventeen, sixteen, thirteen, ten, seven and three years old. He also takes care of his nephew who lost his parents.

Charles is a farmer who deals in coffee, passion fruit and banana growing. He also takes of animal rearing but on a small scale. He works seven days each week and each day he works for twelve hours. Charles supplements his family income with a produce business which he does seasonally. 

Charles has been in this business since 1997 and he started it for survival in order to earn income. He has acquired this loan so that he can buy fertilizer and insecticides for treating his crops so that they can have high yields. He sells his agricultural products to fellow traders nearby. However, he faces the challenge of dry seasons which leads to low production. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Paula Janet

texts.es:
La señora Paula  se dedica arduamente a la labor de maestro de secundaria de un colegio de la localidad, con 18  años de laborar, es soltera, tiene 2  hijos a su cargo la cual le está brindando  todo el apoyo para que se prepare académica mente.

Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Paula atraviesa, es de  mejorar su vivienda  Por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de cemento, bloques, perlines, hierro, zinc y pago de mano de obra y mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Paula works hard as a secondary school teacher at the local school and has been working there for 18 years. She is single and responsible for two children, to whom she is offering every support so that they can complete their education.

One of the needs that Paula is experiencing is that of improving her home, so she has made the decision to approach Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy cement, cement blocks, purlins, rebar, sheet metal roofing and pay for labor. This will enable her to improve her living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cement, cement blocks, purlins, rebar, sheet metal roofing and pay for labor.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is widowed with six children. She is 65 years old and lives in Puntod, Plaridel,  Misamis Occidental.

Modesta has a grocery store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to  pay for gallons of cooking oil, sacks of sugar, assorted candies and biscuits.

Modesta has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Modesta hopes to have more savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to pay for gallons of cooking oil, sacks of sugar, assorted candies and biscuits

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is an active 40-year-old woman with two sons and two daughters.  Her husband is a farmer while her son is working in a mechanic's shop. 

Sajida has excellent embroidery skills so she provides embroidery services in her community. She is running this business to contribute some amount to the family income and to keep herself busy as she does not like  to waste her skills and precious time by sitting idle at home. Her business is successful and the demand for her embroidery products is increasing day by day. 

Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase fabric and packs of thread of various colors and a variety of beads and laces for her work. A Kiva loan would be helpful for her to continue her work by purchasing important embroidery materials. She is feeling happy after taking out her loan.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and packs of thread of various colors and a variety of beads and laces for her work.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a single enterprising young man, twenty-four years old. He lives in Kyotera town and he is a health worker.

Julius has been in this job for three years where he earns a salary as income. He works six days a week and each day he works for fourteen hours. He offers his services to residents of Kyotera town and those from nearby rural villages. He has acquired this loan in order to complete payment on his plot;  he had deposited half payment on it. He hopes to build his first home on said land. 

Julius's dream is to acquire a large farm as an asset. He faces the challenges of stress and working for long hours. He describes himself as a hard-working man. In the photograph is Julius and the Ugafode credit officer (right to left.)

loans.use: To complete payment on a piece of land

loans.name: Galib

texts.en: Galib is a 41-year-old married man. He is a father with three children: two sons and one daughter. For the past seven years, Galib has been working in a shop selling car spare parts. It is a profitable business and he has a good experience in this field, which makes him a well-known person in his city. The loan he has applied for will help him to buy more spare parts for his workshop, which will improve his business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
This is Nena. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy the grocery items and products needed for her variety store. Her income from the business assisted her children's education as well as their household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan  to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nena dreams of being more successful in business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and son in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region of Armenia. 

Flora is engaged in the kids’ clothes business in a rented stall in the Vanadzor trading market. She sells a large variety of baby clothes, bedding and covers, towels, toys and shoes. She brings all the needed products from Yerevan's wholesale markets in a rented car once or twice a month. 

She has been in this business for five years.  Her stall is well known among the citizens, who are satisfied with the great assortment of products and the quality of service of Flora’s stall.

Flora asks a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams to buy a new collection of infants' covers and bedding.  These are highly demanded among her customers.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of infants' covers and bedding

loans.name: Sefer

texts.en:
Sefer wants to thank all Kiva lenders for the previous loan, which has helped him to buy the necessary materials to complete orders that customers have for his shoe repair workshop. With the previous loan, he had the opportunity to increase his business’ profit and has been very satisfied with the manner in which his business has expanded and grown, improving his family's quality of life.

Now he is requesting a second loan for the same business in order to purchase a new work table, working stock and other materials. 

He plans to continue his business in the future, as his goal is to provide a secure life for his family. Sefer again would like to thank all of the Kiva lenders for their second support!

loans.use: to purchase a new work table, working stock and other materials.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is very thankful for the financial assistance given to her. She used the money in buying balut (fertilized duck eggs) and crackers for her business. Her income from her business assisted with her children's education and their household expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan to purchase stock of balut (fertilized duck eggs) and crackers needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for stock of balut (fertilized duck eggs) and crackers needed in her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married with two children. She is 35 years old and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Vilma is a businesswoman and has a fishpond for shrimp and crab production to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan in the amount of Php. 12,000 to finance  shrimp and crab production. 

Vilma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Vilma hopes to improve their living conditions by using the profits from the business and to build more fishponds for her shrimp and crab production business.

loans.use: to finance shrimp and crab production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy meat to sell in his butcher shop

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en: Hakim is a fifty-five-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in agriculture for thirteen years but also does  fishing to earn additional income. He mainly grows sunflowers and the business has been very lucrative since there is a ready market. Unpredictable weather changes especially prolonged drought and also wild animals are his major challenges while his dream is to venture into mechanized farming. Hakim intends to use the loan to pay for labor.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is aged 32 and married with two children; only one attends school. He is a peasant farmer mainly growing sugarcane for local gin brewing as his major source of earning, a business he has been doing for the last nine years.

John approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 600,000  to hire a machine for squeezing his sugarcane in order to brew local gin, a popular delicacy in the area. John hopes to use the proceeds from the 'waragi' to complete construction of his house.

The major challenge John faces is the price fluctuation for 'waragi' as well as the cost of hiring the machine and he would like to buy his own in the near future except that he is still limited by capital. In the photo is John (left) with the Ugafode credit officer at John's incomplete house, which he hopes to complete with the income from his business.

loans.use: To hire a machine for sueezing sugar canes

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme ROKIA debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 55.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of this group called Benkadi IV are married women with an average age of 42 and on average, six children. They all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and their prior loans were correctly reimbursed. 

Madame Rokia, standing first from left to right in the photo, cultivates maize. With her loan she intends to pay for plowing and buy seeds and fertilizer to maintain one half hectare. The produce is sold right in the village and in Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 55,000 francs CFA per season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana Marina, de estado civil casada, tiene 44 años de edad, de escolaridad 3ro. primaria, tiene 2 hijos que no estudian, se dedica a la compra y venta de rpa típica, inició este negocio por la necesidad de general ingresos económicos para ayudar con los gastos de la familia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para vender como: guipiles, cortes, delantales, perrajes, fajas, etc. Desea en el futuro contar con más capital para poder comprar mas mercadería y asi obtener mejores ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales domésticos. Una de las integrantes no pudo asistir cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Juana Marina, age 44, is married.  She has a third grade education.  She has two children who do not go to school.  She buys and sells typical clothing.  She started this business out of the need to generate income to help with the family expenses.

She organized a group and is requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to buy clothes like blouses, skirts, aprons, shawls, and woven belts, etc.  In the future she wishes to count on more capital in order to be able to buy more merchandise.  This way she will get better earnings.

The other members of the group work in commerce and raising domestic animals.  One of the members was not able to attend when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy and sell typical clothing.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia lives in Kasese, Uganda and is a twenty-eight-year-old single mother of one child. She has been selling clothes for six years, but also does farming to earn extra income. 

A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her child up to the university. Ever-changing customer preferences and trends, coupled with inadequate capital, pose a challenge to her business growth. Her dream is to own a boutique.

Sylivia intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 34 years old, and she is married with four children. She lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, in the Misamis Occidental province of the Philippines.

Lolita is a farmer and she has been growing rice to earn a living for eight years. She has requested a loan amount of 14,000.00 Philippine pesos to buy fertilizer for her rice fields.

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living condition by becoming the rice distributor for the entire municipality.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice fields.

loans.name: Balcon Florido Group

texts.es: El grupo “BALCON FLORIDO” se encuentra conformado por 05 integrantes quienes se encuentran pasando el 14 ciclo. Rosa en el grupo cumple la función de presidenta quien fue elegida por los socios del grupo. Rosa tiene 53 años es casada.  Hace 35 años se dedica a la agricultura juntamente con su esposo y a la vez a la ganadería. Las frutas que producen las distribuyen a los mercados grandes el queso y la leche que obtiene de las vacas que cría las vende a sus vecinos. La  actividad de ganadería y agricultura lo aprendió de sus padres. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y comida para sus animales. Su mayor deseo es terminar de construir su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Rosa es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en:
The “Balcón Florido" group is made up of five members who are in their 14th loan cycle. Rose fulfills the function of chairperson for the group and was selected by the members. Rosa is 53 years old and married. Together with her husband she has farmed for 35 years, raising livestock at the same time.

They distribute the fruit they produce at large markets. She sells the cheese and milk she gets from the cows to the neighbors. She learned the activity of livestock-raising and farming from her parents. 

She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and feed for her animals. Her greatest desire is to finish building her home. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan. Rosa is the first one on the right.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, esta casado, su esposa se dedica al que hacer de  la casa, tiene tres hijos  de 19, 17 y 15 años de edad, 2 de ellos estudian, aparte de su esposa y sus hijos, viven con él su cuñada y el bebe de ella.

Él  trabaja como mecánico en enderezado y pintura, este oficio lo aprendió, por necesidad, ya que sus padres no alcanzaban a cubrir los gastos de la casa, y esto provocaba que por días, no tenían nada que comer, así fue que él, se acerco a un taller de mecánica, como aprendiz, y poco a poco fue aprendiendo este trabajo. Actualmente, tiene 30 años de estar desempeñándose, como mecánico en enderezo y pintura, se moviliza en bicicleta hasta el taller, el cual esta a una distancia de 4 km de su casa, y trabaja de 7 am a 5 pm.


Con el préstamo comprara un nuevo compresor, el cual, es de gran utilidad en su trabajo; puesto que sin el, no tiene como pintar los vehículos que repara, y por ende no terminaría los trabajos, y esto conlleva a que no tenga ingresos, para mantener a su familia, también le provoca inconformidad a sus clientes, por que los vehículos, no son reparados en un tiempo prudente. Pero ahora podrá seguir con su trabajo, gracias al préstamo facilitado.

El sueño que tiene para sus hijos, es verlos preparados profesionalmente, para que puedan enfrentarse al futuro y que no sufran, lo que el vivió. En cuanto a su trabajo, quisiera instalar un gran taller, de servicios automotrices varios, pero reconoce que es necesario que se esfuerce el doble, de lo que hasta hoy, lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 45 years old. He went to school up to the 9th grade. He is married, and his wife dedicates herself to the needs of the household. He has three children, aged 19, 17 and 15, of whom two are in school. In addition to his wife and children, his sister-in-law and her baby also live with him. 

He works as a mechanic in body work and painting. He learned this profession out of necessity, since his parents were not able to cover the household expenses, and for this reason they sometimes went for days without anything to eat. Thus he went to a mechanic's workshop and became an apprentice, and little by little he learned this trade. Currently, he has 30 years of experience as a mechanic in body work and painting. He travels on a bicycle to the workshop, which is 4 kilometers from his house, and he works from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.

With the loan, he will buy a new compressor, which will be greatly useful in his work. Without one, he is unable to paint the vehicles he repairs; thus, he cannot finish the jobs himself and does not have that income to support his family. It is also inconvenient for his customers, because the vehicles are not repaired within a reasonable time. However, now he will be able to continue his work, thanks to the loan provided to him. 

His dream for his children is to see them gain professional training, so that they can face the future and not suffer through what he experienced. With regard to his work, he would like to set up a large workshop offering a range of automotive services, but he recognizes that for this he will have to work twice as hard as he has done up to now.

loans.use: to buy a new compressor.

loans.name: Jorge Santo

texts.es:
Jorge es originario del diamante de las Segovia Estelí ubicada geográficamente en el norte de Nicaragua, su estado civil es acompañado, edad 38 años y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar oficio operador de pozo.

Jorge se caracteriza por ser una persona honrada y muy trabajadora, con los créditos recibidos anteriormente han sido de gran importancia ya que ha realizado mejora en su vivienda y ha solventado algunos compromisos familiares.

Actualmente se desempeña como operador de pozo de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado su función es distribuir el agua a los domicilio a través de equipo de bombeo.

 Con el monto financiado lo destina para la compra materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedrín y ladrillo cuarterón ya que necesita construir un cuarto de habitación ya que le es necesario porque el núcleo familiar va creciendo.

Agradece a kiva por el financiamiento brindado ya que de esta manera podrá mejorar su vivienda y poder dar condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is from Estelí, “Diamante de Las Segovias” [The Diamond of the Segovias], which is located in northern Nicaragua.  He is 38 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two school age children. He job is operating a well.  Jorge characterizes himself as honest and very hardworking.   The loans he received previously were very important because he made home improvements and settled some family obligations.

He currently serves as the operator of a well water and sewer service company.  His job is to distribute water to homes via pumping equipment.  He will use the amount financed to purchase construction materials: cement, sand, gravel, and brick panels. He needs to build a room because his nuclear family is growing.  He is thankful to Kiva for providing the financing because, in this way, he will be able to improve his home and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials: cement, sand, gravel, and brick panels.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
This is Elsie, a 55-year-old woman living in Intramuros, Manila, in the Philippines. Her husband, Ermilando works as a potter. Together they have a child, manage their household, and operate their business. Elsie works hard to provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Elsie sells load wallets, electronic loads, and SIM cards for mobile phones, as well as frozen and processed products. Her store is adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns at least 900 Philippine pesos from sales every day.

Elsie is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy load wallets and SIM cards for mobile phones to sell in her store. She dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes that her son will finish his studies. She meets up with her fellowship members every week to share stories of their work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy load wallets and SIM cards for mobile phones to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jean Carlos Oscar

texts.es: Jean Carlos  de 29 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad de ingeniería civil, estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas propuestas.  Jean Carlos  tiene la meta de culminar sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser un buen ingeniero civil. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Jean Carlos   se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a  kiva por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Jean Carlos, 29, is single and has no children.  He's a nice student in the College of Civil Engineering who studies a lot to reach his objectives.  Jean Carlos's goal is to finish his studies successfully and be able to be a good civil engineer.

With the loan granted he'll pay for his university housing and buy the study supplies he needs.

Jean Carlos is very grateful to Kiva for the help, and signs off with a desire to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to pay for his housing and to buy study supplies

loans.name: Tunka Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento TUNKA,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos  varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Aurora,  tiene 57 años, tiene cinco hijos ya independientes  ella se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso el vive en la zona de Villa Concepción,   la Sra. Aurora utilizara este préstamo para la compra  de leche por cantidad para la elaboración de queso y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  para así de esta manera producir más quesos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, la Sra. Aurora enfrenta retos en su negocio ya que en algunos casos es la escasez de leche que no le permite la producción de quesos por este motivo solicito el crédito, la Sra. Aurora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le dan en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Tunka Communal Bank is made up of eight members, six women and two men.

The president of the bank is Aurora, 57.  She lives in the Villa Concepción area and has five adult children.  She earns a living making and selling cheese.

Aurora will use this loan to buy milk wholesale to make cheese.  She wants to make the most of this opportunity.  She's requesting this loan because she doesn't have the money.  It will benefit her greatly because she can produce more cheese and increase her income.

Sometimes Aurora faces challenges in her business.  The scarcity of milk, for example, prevents her from making cheese.  This is why she requested the loan.

Aurora's happy for the opportunity of being granted the loan.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is married and lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, with her family. Her husband is a fisherman, which is their main source of income, and she also runs a general store to help make a living. 

Cornelia already successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she used to improve her store. Now she is requesting a new loan that she will use to purchase seafood to sell in her store. With the additional revenue that this purchase will generate, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kadenge

texts.en: Kadenge is 35 years old, married and a father of two children. For the past five years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his second loan, in the amount of KES 30,000. He is going to use the loan to service and repair his motorcycle and purchase additional spare parts. He will use the profits to pay school fees for his children and invest back into his business, as well as to continue looking after his family. His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses, so that he can improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to repair and service his motorcycle

loans.name: Gen

texts.en: Gen lives with her family in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is raising two children who still need her support. She operates a general store, selling grocery items to make a living, and has been in this business for a year. Gen joined Gata Daku MPC to gain access to micro finance opportunities. She borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy rice, corn grits, and livestock feed to sell in her store. She wants to improve her business so that in the future she will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn grits and livestock feed to sell.

loans.name: Muhidin

texts.en:
Muhidin runs a small stall which sells computer accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Muhidin lives in Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Muhidin is married and living with four persons in the family home. 

Muhidin began working with Ruma two months ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month he has had around $28-$30 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition at her university.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is married with four children and  lives in Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a retired AFP, and she manages a motor transportation rental and service to make a living. For five years, she has successfully managed her business. Recently, she joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 8,000 PHP to  cover the costs of vehicle maintenance and repairs. She wants to buy another vehicle to expand her business.

loans.use: to cover the costs of vehicle maintenance and repairs

loans.name: Meriel

texts.en:
Meriel is 36 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing 5000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Meriel has been raising livestock for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 46 years old, married and a mother of five children. For the last 13 years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly income of about 10,000 KES from the business. Helen was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and she is applying for her fourth loan, of 30,000 KES, to buy additional stock for her kiosk such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, onions and so on to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as to continue expanding the business operations. Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she may help uplift her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Rosanie

texts.en:
Rosanie is married with three children and she lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, with her family. Her husband is a private employee while she runs a general store to help make a living. In 2008, she joined Gata Daku MPC and it has helped her engage more business. 

Rosanie successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used improve her business, and recently she requested a new loan to purchase goods like sardines, bottled products, dried fish, and kerosene. In the future, Rosanie wants to improve the general living condition of her family, and she is thankful to GDMPC because it helps improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sardines, bottled products, dried fish, and kerosine.

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en:
Stanley is 59 years old has been with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the last three years. He comes from rural Buyanja in the Rukungiri District of Uganda. He is married with five children, and in the photograph he is standing beside his wife. He uses these loans to buy and fatten cows which he sells later at a profit. This has enabled him to meet his daily needs, pay school fees for his children, and buy more land for farming.

Stanley will use this newest loan to buy more cows for fattening. He faces challenges like limited land, and fluctuations in weather and price in the cattle business, but he is a very hardworking man with a lot of experience in this field.

loans.use: To buy cattle for fattening

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru: Мухаммаду 18 лет. Он трудолюбивый и целеустремленный молодой человек. Мухаммад поступил в Государственный Коммерческий Университет. Мухамад любит учиться. Он в школе учился хорошо и отлично. Мухаммад в свободное время помогает отцу по скотоводству. Он старается помочь родителям. В семье их 4 человек. Мухаммад должен оплатить за учебный договор первого курса, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhammad is 18 and in a family of four. He is a hardworking and ambitious young man. Muhammad loves to study and achieved excellent grades in high school, and he has applied to the State Commerce University. In his free time, he tries to help his parents, such as by helping his father with the cows. Muhammad has to pay tuition for his first year of university but doesn't have the money. He is requesting a loan of US$1,100 for tuition payments. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay his university tuition

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey lives in Barra, tudela, Misamis Occidental with his wife and two children. His wife sells barbeque in their village while Jeffrey works as a security guard to make a living. Jeffery operates a motor transportation business and offers it for rental purposes. He personally operates it on his free time and on his day off from work. He borrowed a loan of 6,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to be used to pay for motocycle maintenance. He plans to improve his business and wants to acquire another unit of motorcycle to be used for the business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle and pay for motocycle maintenance

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
This is Isabel, 62, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is single and she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Isabel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Isabel dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Soeurt's Group

texts.en:
Soeurt, a local farmer from Battambang province of Cambodia, is 43 years old and married. She has five children, but currently only two children depend on her. She tackles her family hardship by selling food and farming rice, while her husband helps supplement her income by working as a village chief. Soeurt has been involved in this current business for 20 years, and she has completed seven successful previous loans with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans, and used them to cover the basic needs for her family. 

For this loan, Soeurt formed a group of two. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crops. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her agricultural business with a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her agricultural business

loans.name: Mujeres De Chuixac Group

texts.es:
La señora Teresa Albertina, es soltera, tiene 37 años de edad, de escolaridad primaria completa, se dedica al comercio de ropa tipica, inició este negocio con un capital pequeño que le regalo su padre y  hasta la fecha lleva 8 años de experiencia. cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de mercadería para surtir su venta y poder generar mejores ganancias, desea en el futuro tener una tienda y poder distribuir mercadería. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y crianza de aves de corral. En la fotografia no aparecen 2 de las integrantes del grupo porque no pudieron asistir a esa reunion cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Teresa Albertina is single and 37 years old.  She completed primary school.  She works selling traditional clothing and began the business with a small amount of capital that her father gave her.  She has eight years of experience and counts on the support of her family.

She organizes a group and is requesting a loan that will help her purchase merchandise to supply her sales and to generate more income.  She wants in the future to have a store and to be able to distribute her merchandise.  The other group members work selling and raising caged birds. In the photograph two of the group members do not appear as they were unable to attend the meeting when the picture was taken.

loans.use: To purchase and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru: Сурайё трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 31 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями и сестрой. Сурайё более 3 лет работает в Управление государственной службы при президенте республики Таджикистана. Ее сестра Хатичабону учится в Национальном Университете Таджикистана по специальности Бухучет и аудит. Отец Сурайё работает шофёром, а мама домохозяйка. Сурайё всегда старается помогать родителям. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своей сестры и поэтому она запрашивает займ. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Surayo is a hardworking 31-year-old woman. She is not married and lives with her parents and sister. Surayo has been working in the Department of Civil Service under the president of the Republic of Tajikistan for more than three years. Her sister Khatichabonu studies at the National University of Tajikistan with a major in accounting and auditing. Their father works as a driver, and their mother as a homemaker. Surayo always tries to help her parents. She needs to pay for her sister's tuition and for this reason is requesting a loan. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay her sister's university tuition

loans.name: Zeina 1 Group

texts.en:
Dalal is the featured borrower of Zeina 1 group. She joined together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. Dalal is on the left in the photograph, Wafaa is in the middle, and Zeina is wearing black at the right.

Dalal is a 49-year-old married woman, who has worked with her husband in agriculture business, specializing in olives and olive oils, for the last two years. She is a hard worker who is trying to develop her family's business through an acquired loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, which she will use to buy  olive oil preserving gallons. She will also use part of this loan to buy a new living room for her house.

loans.use: to buy necessary olive oil preserving gallons

loans.name: Siyoeun's Group

texts.en:
Siyoeun, 29, is a mother of three children residing in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. She has been farming rice and working for others for a fee as the main sources of family income for 11 years, while her husband is a construction worker to earn extra income. She can earn about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Siyoeun is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is forming a group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Siyoeun is going to use her portion to buy construction supplies for her husband’s business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase their income so as to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her husband’s business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Sina, 31, lives with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Ponhea Leur district, Cambodia. All of her four children are still in school. To feed the family, Sina and her husband earn a living through tailoring clothes. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Sina’s group consists of five members who live in the same village and she is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy materials for construction of a decent latrine. She hopes to have a clean latrine to for her family's use.

loans.use: to buy materials for construction of a decent latrine

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is 54 years old, married and a father of six children. For the last four years, he has earned a living by selling farm produce in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES. Raymond was introduced to KADET LTD., by our credit officer, and is applying for his second loan of 20,000 KES, to buy seeds, some fertilizer and other farm inputs needed for his business. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children as well as to expand his farming activities. His goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing his income so as to help improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase additional farming inputs for his business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer, providing their main source of income while she managed her flower garden to earn an extra income for their living.  

In 2011, Sarah joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and she gains access to microfinance services. She borrowed a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy fertilizer and composted soil to be use in her flower garden. 

In the future, Sarah wants to build a new and comfortable house for better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure and composted soil, for her garden.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, and is married. She operates a food-vending business, selling viand, snacks and banana cue (deep-fried sweetened banana) for a living. She has been engaged in this business for years. Her husband is a part-time operator in the private sector to earn an extra income. Francisca successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to to improve her business. Recently, she requested for a loan of 10,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to purchase raw ingredients and pots for use in the business. In the future, Francisca hopes to have more products to sell and have her own refreshment store.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and pots

loans.name: Prospero Arnoldo

texts.es: Don Prospero, tiene 58 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Trujillo, Colon. Siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de granos básicos de maíz y frijol, actualmente se dedica al cultivo de arroz desde hace 15 años. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. Esta actividad es su  fuente de ingresos. El ha solicitado diez ciclos de préstamos en ODEF con el actual que es por 15,000 lempiras, este préstamo lo va invertir en limpieza, fertilización y siembra de arroz en tres manzanas de tierra. El objetivo es controlar enfermedades y poder sacar mejor cosecha. Su plan es trabajar siempre para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Don Prospero is 58 years old, married, has four children, and lives in the town of Trujillo, Colon.  He has always worked cultivating basic grains like corn and beans.  He currently works cultivating rice and has for the past 15 years.  He sells his crops in the local market in his area.  That is how he earns his living.  He has requested ten loan cycles from the Kiva partner ODEF and the current request is for 15,000 lempiras (Honduran currency).  This loan will be invested in the cleaning, fertilizing, and planting of rice in three plots of land.  The objective is to control sickness and to be able to get a better crop.  His plan is to work always in order to help his family get ahead.

loans.use: To prepare three plots of land for the planting of rice.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn is 56 years old and a rural villager residing in Srey Santhor district of Kampong Cham Province. She has four children, one of whom is still in school. To overcome the daily financial burden of the family, she has been farming rice, raising pigs, and selling various kinds of vegetables while her husband is a paid construction worker. Together, they have been in these businesses for 25 years, earning about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Yorn has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she has completely repaid her loan with success. The loan has enabled her to maintain her living condition. Now she is applying for another loan to pay the tuition fee for the four years of her son’s bachelor degree in Designing. She hopes that this loan will provide financial support for her son so he can focus on his studying and obtain a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee for her son

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district in Cambodia, Sambo is married and has four children, one of which is still in school and is dependent on her.  She and her husband plant rice on a half hectare of farmland as a main source of their income and buy and sell chicken, and sell grocery items to supplement their income. Sambo has been involved with the current business for 36 years and it has returned her about 35,000 KHR per day to support her family's daily expenses. 

This is the first cycle loan for Sambo with VisionFund. Now she leads a group of three to apply for a loan with VisionFund in loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy chicken for resale. She hopes to increase her income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chicken for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a fifty year old man with a family of five; two of his children are still at home. He is basically an agricultural man, with four acres of coffee plus a piggery project. He is asking for a loan so that he can buy organic fertilizers to apply in his garden. Alongside agriculture, Joseph is a business man with stationary shops in town, which also earns him some income at the end of each month.

Joseph's business acquaintances describe him as a hard-working man. And he considers himself a successful man at his age because through his work, he has been able to educate all his children and is proud to say that they are all graduates and are all successful in life with good jobs.

His main challenge, though, is harsh weather conditions, such as droughts, which leave his coffee garden dry at the end of the season. However Joseph has tried to mitigate such problems by diversifying his income-generating activities such as starting up the retail shop. 

Joseph believes his future is bright thanks in part to this loan opportunity he has through Ugafode, one of Kiva's field partners.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: No's Group

texts.en: No, age 26 and a resident from Kampong Cham province, is a young mother of two kids. One of them is in school, and the other one is too young for school. To earn a living, No grows rice and cassava as the main sources of her family income. Her husband works for others for a fee to earn extra income. No has been involved in this business for eight years, and she can earn about 41,000 KHR per day to support her family. No is in her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has completely repaid back. The previous loan helped her to improve her living condition better than before. No leads a group of two women to a take a new loan with VisionFund. She and her group member are applying for a loan in the amount of 500,000 KHR each. As the group leader, No is planning to use this to loan to buy fertilizer for her farming. She hopes that she can make a bigger business to grow rubber trees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Brenda Azucena

texts.es:
Brenda es una joven de 24 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad. Se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y a realizar los oficios de su casa, los cuales son muchos, y empiezan sus días preparando el desayuno a su esposo e  hijos  para que se marche al trabajo y los otros asistan a la escuela. Después se prepara para hacer la limpieza de su hogar, lavar su ropa, en todas estas actividades, transcurre la mañana y de nuevo prepara el almuerzo para sus hijos. Así son todos los días, un trabajo que no tiene remuneración, pero si la satisfacción de estar en familia y vivir feliz.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar materiales para mejorar la infraestructura del techo de su vivienda, ya que a causa de las resientes lluvias, el techo se ha deteriorado y hay goteras, esto provoca que los electrodomésticos y sus demás pertenencias se dañen. Gracias al crédito, todas estos problemas, serán resueltos y se contribuirá a mejor la calidad de vida de esta familia.

Su objetivo es instalar una tienda en su casa, y ayudar con los ingresos a su esposo. También, desea educar a sus hijos, para que sean personas honestas, responsables y con buenos valores morales.
texts.en:
Brenda, 24, is married and has two children, ages 7 and 4.  She spends her time taking care of her children and doing the many household chores.  She starts her day by making breakfast for her husband and children so they can go to work and school.  Then she gets ready to clean her house and wash the clothes, spending all morning on this.  Then she makes lunch for her children.

This is how Brenda's days are.  It's a job without remuneration but with the satisfaction of being with her family and living happily.

The loan she's requesting is to buy materials to improve the infrastructure of the roof on her house.  The roof has deteriorated because of the recent rains, and it's leaking.  This damages her electrical appliances and other belongings.  Thanks to the loan all these problems will be resolved and her family's quality of life will be better.

Brenda's goal is to set up a store in her house and help her husband with the income.  She also wants to raise her children to be honest and responsible people with good moral values.

loans.use: to improve the roof of her house

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 24 years old and not yet married. He sells items such as wallets, belts, and combs in Naivasha, Kenya. He has been in this business for the past four years and has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd. (Kiva's field partner) in order to buy and stock additional wallets, belts, and combs. With the anticipated profit, he hopes to pay back the loan and pay for his necessities. 

In the near future, Peter hopes to expand his business and support his family.

loans.use: to buy wallets, belts, and combs to stock.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato is married with seven children and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. His wife works as an Avon Products dealer while he operates the furniture-making shop that they own. Renato has been doing this line of work for three years to make a living. He recently joined Gata Daku MPC (Kiva's field partner) and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional materials and tools for his shop. His dream is to improve his business in order to gain more revenue for a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for his shop.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has children. Her husband earns an income through farming while she helps by generating income with her garden. She sells her produce to market and a portion is used for family consumption. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy fertilizer such as manure. She wants to improve their farm by cultivating the vacant land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a married woman who has three children and resides in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marichu helps her husband to manage and operate their farm land, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for years. 

In 2011, she joined Gata Daku MPC and successfully repaid her previous loan that she used to improve her farm. Recently, she requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to cover the cost of farm cultivation and fertilization. In the future, Marichu wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cover the costs of farm cultivation

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 25 years old and from Nakuru, Kenya. She is married to Evans, who does not produce additional income for the family. She supports a family of four, which includes herself, her husband and their two children, who are 2 and 7 years old. 

Miriam has a green grocery shop, a business she has been operating for the last two and a half years. She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from Kadet Ltd. (Kiva's field partner), which she plans to use for buying more stock for her grocer business.

Mary plans to use the expected profit to educate her children and feed her family, and she dreams and hopes that in the future she'll be able to buy a plot and build rental houses on it.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita lives in the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, with her children. 

To make a living, she weaves nipa palms into thatched mats that can be used for various purposes such as roofing. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 23 years. Aside from this, she is engaged in selling fish to earn more income. In 2011, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for additional capital for her business. Lolita is requesting a loan of 9,200 PHP to buy new fishing nets. She plans to use the additional generated revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
Renelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and she also earns additional income from a general store and food vending.

She is borrowing 9000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy raw materials to extend her boarding house. 

Renelyn has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to extend her boarding house.

loans.name: Dorn's Group

texts.en: Dorn, a citizen from Tbaung Khmum district, is a 58-year-old married mother of four children. To earn a living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to provide the family's daily primary expenses. She earns about 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save 5,000 KHR each day. Dorn has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now she is a leader of one group member to take a loan from VisionFund in amount of 500,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use part of her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and another portion to pay for the land rent for doing farming. She hopes to make a good income to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: A mother of two children, Hun, aged 30, lives in a rural area in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. One of her children is in school while the other is too young for school. Rice farming on a half hectare and cassava growing on three hectares of her farmland are the main sources of her family income while her husband works for others for a fee to supplement the income. Hun has been involved with the current business for five years. She is a third-cycle borrower with Visionfund (Kiva’s partner) and has completely repaid her previous loans. The previous loans have improved her family's living condition and enabled her to keep her child in school. Now she is applying for a new loan in order to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to expand the farmland to plant pepper to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik is 61 years old and lives in the village of Pambak in the Lori region of Armenia. He is married and he lives with his wife, son, and daughter-in-law. Norik has higher education in pedagogy. For several years he has worked as a teacher of Armenian History and then as a director of the school. Now he works at the Ministry of Environment of the Republic of Armenia, in the department of Water Resources Management, and is a leading specialist of basins at the Territorial Administration. 

Norik’s workday is very active and several times a day he has to drive to different places using a colleague's car, since he has no car of his own.
Norik requests a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy a car which will save his time and expenses each workday.

loans.use: to buy a car which will save him time and expenses each workday.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
A widowed mother of two children, aged 44, Phalla lives in a rural area of Ek Phnom district. To sustain the family's daily expense, she raises 400 chickens as the main source of her family income. She has been with this current business for 8 years.

This is the first cycle loan for Phalla with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan from VisionFund in order to buy more chickens for raising and another portion to buy chicken feed and build the chicken coop. She hopes to make a good income to provide a better standard living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens for raising

loans.name: Channarin's Group

texts.en:
Channarin, 26, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. She is married and has two children, both of whom are still too small for school. For the last four years, Channarin has been farming rice on four hectares of farmland. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Channarin just joined VisionFund this cycle, and now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Channarin is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield from her rice paddy so she can make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmet is a 49-year-old married Egyptian Albanian man who buys and sells scrap metal for cash. He is a married father of two school-aged children who lives with his family in a northern town with an approximate population of 10,000 inhabitants. 

Not only does Ahmet collect scrap himself, but he also buys it from others, and with his vehicle (which is shown in the picture), he takes it to a city farther north where the metallurgic complex is located.

Ahmet says that he makes a good income from this activity, and that it has grown in the past few years. The loan that he is requesting now will be used to buy scrap metal to sell through his business.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and married with 5 children, one of whom is in school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF, Kiva's field partner, to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sector Minero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SECTOR MINERO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gloria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugo de quinua, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de plástico, venta de comida, venta de salchipapa, venta de dulces, tejido de chompas, venta de CD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gloria es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, al observar el comercio que tenía este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras, arroz) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas a la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el servicio en salud.
texts.en:
The “SECTOR MINERO” communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación center.  It’s made up of nine members and run by a board of directors where Gloria serves as the president.

The members’ businesses include quinoa sales, food sales, neighborhood stores, plastic sales, candy sales, sweater making, and CD sales.

This loan will benefit these small companies including Gloria’s.  She says that it’s her first time with Pro Mujer and joined on the invitation of another member.  She sells food and started this business several years ago, having seen the sales that this product has.

She will use the money to buy vegetables and rice in the fairs around El Alto.  She will then use them to prepare food at her point of sale.  This work allows her to generate income to benefit her household however possible.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings and health benefits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es: Don José vive en casa propia su esposa  y sus dos hijos, él es comerciante  tiene un negocio de venta y reparación de  relojes y  lentes lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela por su amabilidad y  buenos precios,  José solicita un  crédito  para capital de trabajo  y comprar más relojes, lentes, baterías, brazaletes, etc.  todo por mayor ya que es un hombre emprendedor  por esa razón desea así poder mejorar y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia.
texts.en: Jose lives in a home of his own with his wife and two children.  He is a merchant and has a business repairing watches and eyeglasses, located near his home.  He has many customers because of his friendliness and good prices.  Jose is asking for a loan so he can increase his working capital and buy more watches, glasses, batteries, watchbands, etc. in quantity.  He is an enterprising man and wants to improve and offer a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy watches and eyeglasses.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
This loan group consists of two partners, both of whom are business owners. 

One is named Elizabeth. She is a 36-year-old single mother who has a 13-year-old son. She has been selling cooking utensils in her community of Dansoman, Ghana for more than 2 years. She has been a member of this microfinance institution for 2 years and is requesting a loan of 1,000 GHS to increase her stock of cooking utensils to sell to customers. 

The other member of the group is Christopher. He is 24 years old and sells fish.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Regina's group has three members who all live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Regina (standing left in the photo), is 32 years old and married to a man named Samuel. The couple has three children who attend school, all of whom are still their financial responsibility. Regina lives together with her children and husband and together they are responsible for the household expenses. For the past 9 years, Regina has been selling food (cassava, plantain, yam and vegetable) in her area. Regina buys her produce in a village in eastern region. 

This is the fourth time Regina and the other members of this group are requesting for a loan amount of 2,700 GHS in order to strengthen their working capital and better respond to client demand. The first three loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy and sell cassava, plantain, yam and vegetables to customers

loans.name: Kimoun's Group

texts.en:
Kimoun, 38, is a widowed mother of four children residing in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. Two of her children are still in school and another one is too young to attend school. To make a living, she has been farming cassava and growing cassava for three years as the main source of income and she works as a hairdresser to earn an extra income. She can earn about 26,000 KHR per day. 

Kimoun has been with VisionFund for two loans and she has successfully repaid them back. The past loan has helped her to support her family's living and enabled her to keep her children in school. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to pay for labor fees for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy items for her hairdresser job. She hopes to expand her business to increase her family’s income and improve their living.

loans.use: to buy items for her hairdresser job and pay for labor fees for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en: Freddie lives in Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental with his family. He is married and has three children. His main source of income comes from farming. He joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizer such as manure. He plans to cultivate all the vacant lot in order to gain more harvest in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Benkadi V Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI V sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme KADIATOU debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 95.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi V group are married women averaging 42 years of age, with five children. They all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, a village in Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their third loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid their prior loans. They grow corn, which is what Mrs. Kadiatou does, for example. She is the first one standing from the left on the photo.
