With her loan she plans to pay for the cost of labor, seeds and fertilizers to work 0.5 ha [1.2 acres] of land. After harvesting, she sells her produce in the village and in the Sikasso region, to a customer base composed of both men and women.
She plans to earn 95,000 West African francs per agricultural campaign. This income will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of labor, agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Pajoca 1 Group

texts.es:
Micaela  (aparece como cuarta de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía) es una mujer de 41 años de edad ella está casada y vive en el Caserío Pajoca, Aldea Xojola Nahualá, Sololá. Ella tiene 4  hijos de ellos 2  hombres y 2 mujeres  ambos apoyan a sus padres para salir adelante.
Ella  se dedica al cultivo de  banano a unos metros de su vivienda. Comenta que eligió esta actividad porque le gusta y además lo puede comercializar en el mercado local de su comunidad. Gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres ella tiene la oportunidad de trabajar y sostener a su familia.
Ahora cuenta con 25 años de realizar esta labor que le ha generado ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a contribuir a los gastos de su familia.
Doña Micaela  es una mujer líder en su comunidad logrando organizar un grupo de mujeres que desean mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias y es por ello que solicitan un préstamo para el mantenimiento y compra de semillas de banano. 
Su sueño es comprar más terreno para poder ampliar su cultivo  y de esta manera generar más ganancias que le ayudaran a darle una  mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Micaela (fourth from the left in the photo) is a 41 year old married woman who lives in the Pajoca, Aldea Xojola Nahualá settlement.  She has four children; two sons and two daughters.  They all help their parents to get ahead.

She raises bananas a few meters from her home and says that she selected this business because she likes it and because she can sell in the local market.  Thanks to her parents’ teachings, she is able to work and support her family.

She has been doing this for 25 years, which has generated an income and acceptable earnings for her so she can contribute toward the family expenses.

Micaela is a community leader and was able to organize a group of women who want to improve their families’ living conditions.  This is the reason they are requesting a loan to maintain and buy banana seeds.

Her dream is to buy more farmland so she can expand her crops and generate more profits that will help her provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy banana seed.

loans.name: Kisenyi Tugonzangane2 Group

texts.en:
The story was given by Mary, a lady standing in the front row on the extreme right.

Mary is a 31-year-old single mother of two children aged 4 and 1 year respectively. Mary operates a small bar at her home in Kisenyi village an outskirt of Kagadi town where she earns money to support her two children and herself. She also practices agriculture as an additional activity for getting food for the family and selling the surplus for more money.

Mary borrowed a loan of 150,000 UGX previously from Ugafode to add to her bar business and she says it worked for her. Now she wants more 300,000  UGX (Three hundred thousand shillings) to rent land for planting maize and beans for this season so that she can harvest more than what she can harvest in her own gardens.

Mary's dream is to buy a piece of land and put up a family house.  She would also like to own instead of renting and also use the land for agriculture. However, her major challenge is the limited money she has to achieve her dream. She appreciates the assistance rendered to her and she would like to request more. The 14th person in the picture is a group member who is saving and will get a loan in the next cycle, she signed the waiver form though.

loans.use: to pay for land rental for farming

loans.name: Pajoca 2 Group

texts.es:
Manuela (aparece como la cuarta de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía) es una mujer de 62 años de edad ella está casada y vive en el Caserío Pajoca, Aldea Xojola Nahualá, Sololá. Ella tiene 2  hijos de ellos 1  hombres y 1 mujeres  ambos apoyan a sus padres al mantenimiento de su cultivo.
Ella  es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica al cultivo de  banano a unos metros de su vivienda. Comenta que eligió esta actividad porque le gusta y además lo puede comercializar en el mercado local de su comunidad. Gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres ella tiene la oportunidad de trabajar y sostener a su familia.
Ahora cuenta con 45 años de realizar esta labor que le ha generado ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a contribuir a los gastos de su familia.
Doña Manuela es una mujer líder en su comunidad logrando organizar un grupo de mujeres que desean mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias y es por ello que solicitan un préstamo para el mantenimiento y compra de semillas de banano. 
Su sueño es comprar más terreno para poder ampliar su cultivo  y de esta manera generar más ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela (fourth from the right in the photo) is a 62 year old married woman who lives in the Pajoca, Aldea Xojola Nahualá settlement.  She has two children; a son and a daughter.  Both help their parents maintain the crop.

She is a hardworking women who raises bananas a few meters from her home and says that she selected this business because she likes it and because she can sell in the local market.  Thanks to her parents’ teachings, she is able to work and support her family.

She has been doing this for 45 years, which has generated an income and acceptable earnings for her so she can contribute toward the family expenses.

Manuela is a community leader and was able to organize a group of women who want to improve their families’ living conditions.  This is the reason they are requesting a loan to maintain and buy banana seeds.

Her dream is to buy more farmland so she can expand her crops and generate more profits that will help her provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy banana seed.

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNIDOS AL FUTURO”  está conformado por 07 socias trabajadoras quienes se encuentran pasando el 11 ciclo. Sabina tiene 54 años es casada con hijos todos independientes en el grupos cumple la función de secretaria  quien fue elegida por los socios del grupo. Sabina hace 10 implemento su bodega en su vivienda años tras trabajaba en el grupos comunales en la zona que vive de esta manera a podido apoyar a su esposo con la educación de sus hijos cuando estos eran menores de edad el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite. Su mayor deseo es implementar mas su negocio y de esta manera poder mejorar su economía familiar. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Sabina es la que viste casaca negra de cuero. Y de la misma manera se encuentra la foto de Angélica en la parte superior izquierdo. Que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
Unidos al Futuro Group is made up of seven hardworking members who are in their eleventh loan cycle.

Sabina, 54, is married and has adult children.  She's the secretary of the group, having been elected by the members.  She set up her grocery store in her home years 10 years ago.  She used to work in communal banks in the area where she lives, so she was able to help her husband with her children's education when they were minors.

She'll invest the loan in buying rice, sugar, and oil.

Her greatest desire is to develop her business more so she can improve her family finances.

The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan.

Sabina's the one wearing a black leather jacket.  At the upper left is the photo of Angélica, who couldn't attend the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Pabaquit Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana es casada, tiene 40 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos y 4 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la compa y venta de maíz, inicio este negocio son su suegro y a la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo, desea en el futuro tener una tienda donde pueda distribuir maiz por mayor, los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y actividades pecuarias.
texts.en:
Juana is 40 years old, married, and did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She has five children and four of them attend school.  She buys and sells corn and started this business with her father in law and has 10 years’ experience.  Her husband helps her.

The is part of a group and is asking for a loan so she can increase her working capital and wants to have a store in the future, where she can sell corn in bulk.  The other members are merchants and raise livestock.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Oscar Arnulfo

texts.es:
Oscar, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para continuar invirtiendo en el negocio de venta de leña y alborotos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar maíz, dulce, leña, entre otros para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le permitió incrementar sus inventarios y obtuvo mayores ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Oscar needs a new loan so he can continue to invest in his business of selling firewood and food items.  This will allow him to buy corn, candy, firewood, and other things for his customers.

The previous loan allowed him to increase his inventory and earnings.  The financial situation and quality of life has improved for his family.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима родилась в семье преподавателя в 1950 году. После окончания средней школы она поступила Педагогический Институт. Она успешно окончила институт, вышла замуж и родила 5 детей. Она много лет работала в средней школе и преподавала математику. Данное время она работает в общественной организации. Она является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж умер. Она вдова. Халима старается улучшить условию проживания. Ей одной тяжело обеспечить семью и поэтому она хочет отправить сына в Российскую Федерацию на заработки. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Halima was born in a teacher’s family in 1950. After graduating from secondary school, she enrolled into Teacher’s College. She has graduated successfully, got married and had five children. She has worked for many years as a secondary school math teacher. She is the main breadwinner in her family since her husband  passed away and she was left  widowed. Halima tries to improve her family’s life condition. It is hard for her to support the family on her own, which is why she wants to send her son to find temporary work in the Russian Federation. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 TJS in order to buy an air ticket [for her son]. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an air ticket for her son.

loans.name: Jesus Salvador

texts.es:
Jesús, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio de venta de helados; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar diversidad de mercadería, tales como: sorbete, paletas, vasitos, conos, entre otros.
Don Jesús cuenta que el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios  y obtuvo mayores ingresos, con ello ha logrado aportar a la familia. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Jesus needs a new loan because he needs more working capital to invest into his frozen treats business.  This investment will help him buy some diverse merchandise such as sorbet, popsicles, cups, cones, and other things.

Jesus says that the previous loan helped him to increase his inventory and he increased his revenue.  This has allowed him to provide the family with better financial conditions and their circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy frozen treats and supplies.

loans.name: Ingrid Anayancy

texts.es:
Ingrid de 29 años de edad, estudio solamente hasta 4º grado, porqué en esos días, estaba en auge el conflicto armado que se vivía en el país, y por motivos de seguridad sus padres prefirieron no mandarla a estudiar. Actualmente, esta casada y tiene una hija de 4 años. En su casa viven sus padres, pero ellos no dependen económicamente de ella.

Ella a instalado un negocio de tortilleria, desde hace 5 años a lo largo de este tiempo a ganado muchos clientes, quienes todos los días se acercan a comprar las indispensables tortilla de maíz en la dieta diaria de los salvadoreños. Este actividad la aprendió de su madre, recuerda que cuando estaba pequeña, su madre preparaba la masa, para elaborar las tortillas, y ella se acercaba para ayudarle. Ingrid, solo se ha dedicado a este negocio, su madre también se involucra para ayudarle en el negocio, el cual esta ubicado en su casa, y tiene dos horarios de trabajo al día, el primero es de 10.30 am hasta 1 pm y de 4 pm hasta las 5.30 pm.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar maíz, leña y ampliar el lugar donde esta la hornilla. Se le ayudara grandemente, para que siga con su trabajo y de esa forma, asegurar los ingresos para su alimentación.

Como toda madre, ella tiene planificado brindarle todo el apoyo a su hija; y desea que se supere, y que no atraviese las dificultades que a tenido que pasar. También, desea seguir en el negocio y cancelar el crédito para tener la posibilidad  de  futuros créditos, para mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 29 years old and she studied only until the 4th grade. The reason for this is that in those days was the height of the armed conflict her country was living through. For safety reasons her parents preferred not to send her to school. These days she's married and has a 4 year old daughter. Her parents also live in her house, but they are not financially dependent on her.

Ingrid established a tortilla making business 5 years ago. During this time she has earned many clients who come daily to purchase the indispensable tortillas, which are a staple part of the Salvadoran diet. She learned this skill from her mother. Ingrid remembers that as a little girl her mother would make the dough for the tortillas, and she would come close in order to help her. This has been Ingrid's only business, and her mother helps her. The business is located in their home and they keep 2 work schedules, the first one is from 10:30 am until 1 pm and the second one from 4 pm until 5:30 pm.

She will use the loan to purchase corn, firewood and to enlarge the area where she keeps the burner. This will be a great help so that she can continue with her work, earning an income to feed her family.

As every mother would, Ingrid plans to provide her daughter with all the support she needs. She hopes her daughter will be able to improve herself and that she won't have to go through the same difficulties. Furthermore, she hopes to continue in her business and to settle her loan in order to have a chance to request future loans to improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood and to enlarge the area where she keeps the burner

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es:
Lleny, de 44 años de edad, está casada con Juan quien es comerciante y padre de sus 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, de 20, 17 y 08 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa que  compraron con el fruto de su esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Lleny es la venta de bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas y aguas envasadas de variados sabores y marcas, cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con un préstamo y la instaló en su casa, desde allí  los atiende de manera amable y cordial ya que sabe que con ese trato se ganará la preferencia de sus clientes. Se inició con un préstamo que le sirvió para realizar sus primeras compras, viendo la acogida que tuvo su negocio y con las ganancias que le dejaba reinvirtió su capital logrando comprar bebidas en mayores cantidades. Hasta el momento trabaja sola y le va muy bien.
Comenta que antes de empezar con su negocio no tenía problemas, pero si tenía el deseo de contar con una ocupación laboral que le sirva para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente, viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y aumentar su mercadería para ver crecer su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero que le permita salir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de aguas envasadas, gaseosas y cervezas de diversas marcas y tamaños.
texts.en:
Lleny is 44 years old and is married to Juan who is a merchant and the father of her four children.  Only three of them live at home and are 20, 17, and 8 years old respectively.  They live together comfortably in the home that they acquired with lots of effort.  Lleny sells carbonated beverages such as beer, and bottled water of different brands and flavors.  She has a refrigerator that she bought with money from a loan and set up in her house.  From there she serves her customers in a friendly and cordial manner.  She know that this way she will win her customers over.  She began with a loan which she used to make her first purchases and she reinvested her profits to where she could buy in quantity.  She works on her own and things are going very well for her.

She says that she didn’t have any problems before starting her business, but she wanted to have an occupation so that she could help her husband with the household expenses.  Currently, after seeing the good results, she plans to continue and increase her inventory so she can grow her business.  She is asking for  a loan of S/ 1,000 and she is very grateful for the opportunity and the financial support that will help her get ahead.  She also promises to pay on time.

She will use the money to buy bottled water, soft drinks, and beers of different brands and sizes.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Fassokadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  FASSOKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme  DJENEBA assise en deuxième position de la   gauche vers la droite  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 85.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "FASSOKADI II" are married women, who average 40 years of age and six children each, all living in polygamous families in KOROBARRAGE, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Ms. DJENEBA, who is sitting second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women at the village, at the market.

She plans on making a profit of 85,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to pay for farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Leili Jeaneth

texts.es:
Leili de 43 años de edad, es casada, estudio hasta noveno grado y su esposo igual, procrearon tres hijos entre las edades de 10 y 17 años. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a sus hijos y esposo a quienes enviá a la escuela, mientras ella se dedica actividades de sastrería, confecciona  pantalones, faldas, etc oficio que aprendió  de su madre y comercializa en su lugar de residencia y alrededores; su esposo realiza actividades agrícolas, ambos ayudan al sustento de la familia.

El préstamo lo esta solicitando para comprar una vaca,  que le ayudara a producir  leche y con la venta  generara ingresos para el sustento de su familia. En un futuro desea comprar mas vacas lecheras y poder  producir leche para la venta.
texts.en:
Leili is 43 years old, married and she studied until the 9th grade as did her husband. Together they have three children between the ages of 10 and 17 years old. She wakes up at 4:00 am along with her children and husband and she sends the children to school. 

Meanwhile, she works as a tailor and makes pants, skirts, etc. She learned this trade from her mother, and she sells her products in her neighborhood and nearby areas. Her husband works in agriculture, together they help to support the family.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase a cow, which will help her produce milk. By selling this milk she will generate an income to support her family. In the future, she hopes to purchase more milk cows and in this way produce milk for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, which will help her produce milk

loans.name: Fassokadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  FASSOKADI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est: le maïs avec Mme MAMOU DAOU debout en première position de la   gauche vers la droite  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 95.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "FASSOKADI I" are married women, who average 40 years of age and six children each, all living in polygamous families in KOROBARRAGE, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Ms. MAMOU DAOU, who is standing first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women at the village, at the market.

She plans on making a profit of 95,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Isareri

texts.en: Isareri deals in the local brew trade and he is requesting a UGX 1,000,000 to help him buy a piece of land where there is a plantation of bananas to help him make the local brew. This will help him reduce his expenditure on bananas and save money to do other businesses as well as meet his family's needs. He is hard working and thanks UGAFODE for meeting his needs when he has needed the money the most.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land

loans.name: Muniran

texts.en:
Muniran is a 43-years-old woman who is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband, four sons and three daughters. 

Her husband runs a crockery shop, which is the only source of income for their family. He purchases a variety of crockery and sells them in his shop. Currently he wants to offer new varieties to his customers. However due to lack of finance he finds it difficult.  

Therefore, Muniran has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase crockery of new varieties for her husband's shop. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business. Muniran is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase crockery to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for training to improve her seamstress skills

loans.name: Genalin

texts.en:
Genalin is 43 years old, married and has 4 children, two of whom are in school. 

Genalin is a farmer She raises pigs in the Philippines. Genalin requests a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Genalin has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Genalin would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marrian

texts.en: Marrian is a twenty-four-year-old woman from Liberia who lives in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. She completed 6th grade.  She and her fiance live together and have a four-year-old child who is attending school. She started her business with a little bit of money from her older sister and, for four years now, she has been running a table where she sells onions, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt etc. She spends 9 hours on her business; a problem she faces is low income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt etc. for her business. Her dream is to one day open a shop and see her children out of high school.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an increased amount of cassava, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Gari’ (a traditional snack) sales.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is a 47-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been working as an accountant, and with the salary savings he has been able to buy land for farming. With the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy more land.

His desire is to upgrade in his studies and also educate his children up to the University. Jonas intends to use the loan to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself.

loans.name: Zvataida Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe. This is 58-year-old Molly from Mutare. Molly is a member of Zvataida Group. She is married with six children, and two are attending school. 

Molly runs a poultry-rearing business, producing chickens. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge being faced is shortage of day-old chicks from suppliers due to high demand. Molly has requested a loan of $400 to buy chicks and feed for the poultry project. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, Molly plans to raise multiple batches of chicks at the same time.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase African-print cloth, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 46 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Estrella is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Estrella requests a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Estrella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and other sewing materials to sew dresses to sell in order to increase her profit.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru: Парвизу 19 лет. Он учится на 2 курсе Национального Университета Таджикистана по специальности юриста. Он учится хорошо и отлично. Парвиз в свободное время занимается спортом. Он активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Парвиз имеет много друзей. Его друзья ценят его дружбу и честность. Парвиз должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Его родители простые рабочие и не в состоянии оплатить за учёбу сына в университете. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Parviz is 19 years old.  He is a second-year student at the Tajik State National University, majoring in law and doing very well.  During his spare time, he enjoys being involved in sports.  He is also very active in his university social life and has a lot of friends who value his friendship and honesty.

Parviz needs to pay his tuition fees, but he doesn't have enough money to do so.  His parents are simple workers and not in a position to pay for their son's higher education.  He is requesting a loan to pay his tuition.  He is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Azizkhon

texts.ru: Азизхон житель города Куляб. Ему 40 лет. Он семьянин. У него пятеро детей. Азизхон сейчас безработный. У него есть немного сбережения и он хотел бы начать свой собственный бизнес по предоставлению услуги такси. Азизхон просит кредит, чтобы купить автомашину марки Опель. Он хочет начать работу по маршрутной линии город Куляб - город Душанбе. У него есть водительские права и опыт вождения. Азизхон планирует выходить на работу с шести утра и продолжать до восьми вечера. Он будет усердно работать, чтобы улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Azizkhon lives in the city of Kulob, Tajikistan.  He is married and the father of five children.  He is currently unemployed.  He has a few savings and he would like to start his own business providing taxi services.  He is requesting a loan in order to buy a car (an Opel).

He wants to start offering his taxi services along the Kulob - Dushanbe route.  He has a driver's license and he is an experienced driver.  He plans to work from 6 AM until 8 PM.  He will work hard, in order to improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a car in order to start a business providing taxi services.

loans.name: Fassokadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  FASSOKADI III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme  MAMOU debout en première position de la   gauche vers la droite  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 85.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of FASSOKADI III group are married women who average 40 years of age and six children. They all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, one of the villages in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their third loan from the MFI, and the previous loans were repaid without problems.

Mrs. Mamou (first one on the left in the standing row) is growing corn. She intends to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market in the village, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average profit of XOF 85'000 (ca US$ 170) per planting.

This profit will be used to repay the loan, and also to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Fassokadi V Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  FASSOKADI V sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme TATA assise en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 80.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of FASSOKADI V group are married women who average 40 years of age and six children. They all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, one of the villages in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their third loan from the MFI, and the previous loans were repaid without problems.

Mrs. Tata (second woman from the right in the sitting row) is growing corn. She intends to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market in the village, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average profit of XOF 80'000 (ca US$ 160) per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan, and also to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Yah B.

texts.en: Yah B. lives in Ganta, she is 39 years old, and has 4 children between 10 to 20 years old who are in school and live at home. She stopped her education in the 9th grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. For the past 14 years she has been running a shop where she sells rice by the cup.  She started this business with money that she received from her husband. Some problems she is facing is that sometimes she does not have enough customers. Her business is open Monday to Saturday and she spends twelve hours a day at work. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, vita, oil, rice okra to attract her customers. Her future plans are to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, vita, oil, rice okra to attract her customers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 42 years old, she is married, and has two children. She has her own home in a neighborhood of Dannsoman, Ghana. She is a responsible woman and a hard working person. 

Esther has been selling fish for three years. She works everyday, getting up each morning at 5 o'clock to smoke fish ordered by her customers, who are her local friends and neighbors. Esther is applying for a GHS 1,000 loan in order to purchase two cartons of fish to smoke and sell to her customers.

Esther hopes that this investment will help her to improve her quality of life and that of her family, to continue improving her home, and to help her children get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase two cartons of fish to smoke and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fassokadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  FASSOKADI IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme KOROTOUMOU assise au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 80.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the FASSOKADI IV group are married women, who are, on average, 40 years old and also have an average of six children each.  They all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, one of the villages of the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali). They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans. 

Korotoumou, a member of the group, grows maize.  In the photo, she is in the front row, in the middle of the group.

She plans to use her loan to cover the cost of plowing and to buy seeds and fertilizers in order to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.  After the harvest, she sells her crop in her village, at the market, to a customer base consisting of both men and women.

She is expecting to make a profit of 80,000 CFA francs per growing season.  This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Mavambo Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 29-year-old Cecilia from Mutare. Cecilia is a member of Mavambo Group. She is married with two children, one attending school. She also cares for two dependants. Cecilia runs a retail business selling electrical goods, kitchen utensils and groceries. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenge she is facing is high import duty at the border posts. Cecilia has requested a loan of $600 to buy electrical goods like televisions and stoves to supply to farmworkers around the town. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future Cecilia plans to operate a shop in town.

loans.use: To buy electrical gadgets for resale in Mutare and farms around the town

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more electrical parts

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.ru: Искандар трудолюбивый человек. Ему 49 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его жена работает в государственной организации делопроизводителем. Ее старшая дочь учится на 3 курсе Технологического Университета. Ее младшая дочь Фарзона учится в средней школе. Его сын в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Технический Университет в городе Рига. Искандар должен оплатить за учебный договор своего сына и поэтому запрашивает займ. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Iskandar is a hard-working man.  He is 49 years old and is married with three children at home.  His wife works as a clerk in a government office.  His eldest daughter is in her third year at the technical university, and his youngest daughter, Farzona, is in high school.  His son finished high school this year and was offered a place at the technical university in Riga.  Iskandar needs to pay for his son's tuition, which is why he is asking for a loan.  He is awaiting your kindness and counting on your charity.

loans.use: To pay for his son's education in Riga

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, hair cream, and hair extensions

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат 52 года. Она вдова так ее муж умер несколько лет назад. Она имеет одного ребенка. Ее сын Хуршед учится в Техническом Университете. Она более 31 года работает в средней школе. Она преподает математику. Саодат умная женщина и ее коллеги любят и уважают ее. Саодат всю свою жизнь посвятила своему сыну и после смерти мужа она не вышла повторно замуж. Саодат хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Саодат запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов, как краски, обои, дверь, окна и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Saodat is 52 years old and she is a widow, as her husband died a few years ago.  She has one child.  Her son, Hurshed, studies in the technical university.  Saodat has worked as a high school math teacher for more than 31 years.  She is an intelligent woman and her colleagues like and respect her.  Saodat has been dedicated to her son her whole live and after her husband died she did not marry again.  She wants to make repairs to her home, as it is in poor condition.  Saodat is asking for a loan of $1,500 to buy building materials like paint, wallpaper, a door and windows.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as paint, wallpaper, a door and windows for repairing her house

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a married man, aged 37. He has four children who are aged 10, 8, 6, and  4 years, and all of them attend school. Mathew is a clinic officer, and he has been in this business since 2011 as the major source of income for the family.

Mathew approached Ugafode for a loan of 800,000 UGX to pay his school fees at the university to upgrade his studies, which he hopes will build skills and attract better pay for him.

He hopes to expand his clinic for better earnings after completing his studies.

loans.use: To pay his university tuition

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria lives in the Mariakani area, a few miles from Mombasa, Kenya. She is a trained tailor, which is her business. Maria is 28 years old and she is married. She was having a difficult time in life before she started her own business to keep up with the pace of life. Maria knew of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy cloth material, needles and other items for her tailoring shop. In the next five years she wants to have built a customer base. Maria plans to use the extra income raised to open more branches of her business and employ people.

loans.use: to buy cloth material, needles and other items for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase increased amounts of second hand clothings, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for his business to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her bakery

loans.name: Syrina

texts.en:
Syrina, aged 39, is married with one child. She has a son and together they live in Dansoman, Ghana. 

Eleven years ago, she started operating a charcoal business. On weekends and seasonally, she also sells food to earn more income. With the goal of keeping her business stocked and active, she has decided to apply for a loan of GHS 1,000 to buy six bags of charcoal to sell in a one month duration to customers. 

Her goal is to grow her business and that way be able to help her son so that he can finish his schooling.

loans.use: buy six bags of charcoal to sell in a one month duration to customers.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a married woman; She has been running a general store business for the past two years with the support of her husband. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. In order to avoid shortages, Asia needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. That is why she applied for her second loan of PKR 25,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar and juices. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar and juices.

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus is 28 years old. For the last year, he has earned a living by selling open shoes in Malindi, earning a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. 

Nicodemus was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and he is applying for his second loan of KES 20,000 to purchase additional stock needed for his business. He will use the profit from the business to pay the school fees of his niece, purchase food for the family and expand the current business. 

Nicodemus hopes to continue growing his business in future so as to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional open shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 28 years old, single, and lives in Nimba County in Liberia. Nimba is one of the most resource-rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore. The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea. As a result, many people on business pass through the area bringing lots of trade. It is also the second most populous area in Liberia.
 
Mamie went to school and finished the 8th grade. Her fiancee is wood seller. She has three children aged between 4 and 7, they are in school and live at home.

She has been operating a shop for the past six years, selling rice, milk, sugar, pepper, oil etc. She works at her business for nine hours each day. She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is less goods in her shop.  

With the proceeds from the loan, Mamie wants to buy rice, milk, sugar, pepper and oil etc. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house. She is proud of her business because she gets money for her everyday expenses.
  
She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, sugar, pepper and oil.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 33-year-old married woman. For the past eight years, she has been successfully running a business selling milk. She sells milk and yogurt to the people of her community. 

Over time, Zarina has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Zarina's husband is employed in a textile mill but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. 

Zarina is requesting a 20,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to purchase a cow. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. She is trying hard to fulfil their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband have been doing agricultural work for many years. She grows different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides, Zubaida applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Zaqiya

texts.en:
Zaqiya is a 45-year-old widow, and has been running a business of buying an selling animals for the past 15 years. She has one buffalo and three goats. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She also deals in milk sales to generate an extra amount of income.  

Currently, she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 38 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She has a business selling clothes in her community. She buys a variety of clothes from the main city market and sells them to the people of her town. 

She started her business because it was very difficult for her to meet her family's household needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband in earning. Now, she plays a very important role in supporting her family. 

Shabana has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000, which will allow her to purchase a greater collection of clothes in different designs and colors, to take account of the taste and choice of her customers. Shabana expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase a greater collection of cloths in different designs and colors.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila is a married woman and the mother of four children. She has been running a beauty parlor business for the past two years. She offers many options to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing her best services she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetic products for the parlor.  Because of having low cash on hand she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to cater to more customers as time goes on. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a forty-four-year-old man. He is married to Hannah and is a father of three children. He runs a retail shop in Kimende on the outskirts of Limuru town. He recently bought a motorcycle and started a motorcycle transport business. He gets a monthly income of fifty-five thousand seven hundred Shillings.

This will be George's eighth loan with KADET Ltd. He has successfully paid back all the other loans. He plans to use the loan to buy another motorcycle. In future he wants to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is a 45-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is  married and has five children between the ages of 10 and 27. Only two of the children are in school and live at home. Fatu describes herself as hard working.

She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire. Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. The area also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

Fatu has a table business where she sells rice, pepper, oil, vita (a juice drink), onions, etc. She has been in this business for the past two years. She works 10 hours a day at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is fewer goods in her shop. She intends to use the loan to buy more rice, pepper, oil, vita, onions, etc. for her business. She started her business with money from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She hopes to one day to build a house.
  
Fatu is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, oil, vita, onions, etc.

loans.name: Shehla

texts.en:
Shehla, aged 25, has a business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them at the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income.  

Shehla is a dedicated mother of four. She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase another goat. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another goat.

loans.name: Wavinya

texts.en:
Wavinya lives in the Mariakani area in Kenya. She is just 23 years old and is married with one child. 

She started her business from her own savings and has managed to keep it running for some time now. She heard of Milango through friends who invited her and she joined. She now seeks a loan to buy 50 kgs of sugar, 90 kgs of flour and 40 litres of cooking oil. 

In the next five years she wants to own a wholesale shop. The challenges in the business include customers not paying in time and funds to buy stock. The income from the loan use will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy 50 kgs of sugar, 90 kgs of flour and 40 litres of cooking oil.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 43 years old and lives in Sanniquillie, the capital city of Nimba County. It is rich in nature resources, and living condition are much better than in the country's capital city. It is the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

Helena did not go to school, and she has lived all her live in a rural area. In accordance with tradition, she is married. Helena's husband is a security man, and they have five children, aged between 9 and 21 years old. Only three of her children are in school. 

From selling her garden products, she was able to establish her business. Since 2008, she has been running a table where she sells fashion clothes. She spends nine hours a day on her business. One of the problems she faces is a small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes for her business. Her plan is to one day send her children to vocation school.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nooran

texts.en:
Nooran is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband on the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field.  Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand in her store. She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and charcoal

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a young lad aged 25, and is single. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport industry for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He learnt about KADET from one of his regular customers who is a registered member of KADET. He has now acquired his first loan of KES 76,411, which will enable him to acquire his own motorcycle. He will use the proceeds from his business to repay his loan.

His dream is to make more money and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cattle, sheep and goats

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en:
Mehnaz, aged 35, has been involved in a business selling clothes for a period of about five years. She buys a variety of printed and embroidered clothes from the main city market, and then sells to the people of her local community. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Mehnaz requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different clothes for the summer season, by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 43-year-old married woman, and a mother of two. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

She requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different clothes for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. 

Allah Rakhi is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different clothds for the summer season.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 51-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a clinical officer for 25 years, and with her salary savings she has been able to start a clinic but also works at a government hospital. She has dreams of educating her children and building a permanent house. Alice intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Jonan

texts.en:
Jonan is 35 years old, and is married with two children, one of whom attends school. Jonan is a farmer who mainly grows coffee, and has a nursery bed for coffee seedlings which he at times sells to other farmers. He has been in this business for the last three years. Jonan gets additional income from keeping poultry.

He has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to enable him to construct a water tank where he can get water for his poultry and coffee seedlings during the dry season. Water scarcity is always his major challenge during the dry season, and he hopes that by constructing this water tank it will boost his farming projects. 

Jonan is pictured in the photograph with a Ugafode staff member.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes and two sacks of cabbages.

loans.name: Nazda

texts.en:
Nazda is a 41-year-old married woman, and a mother of two. She is involved in a business of selling bangles and printed cloths. She always has a great collection to offer, and she is quite familiar with the tastes and demands of her customers. Her husband also assists her in his free time, so that she can manage to perform the household activities as well. She has gradually improved her business. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy more varieties of bangles and cloths in different colors and designs. In this way, she would be able to increase her net income through increased sales. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She dreams of expanding her business and providing a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of bangles and cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Meet Vincent. He runs a Zoona Mobile money transfer business in Lusaka. Vincent wanted the Kiva lenders to know this about him:

“I was born and brought up in the Eastern province of Zambia. My first trip to the capital city (Lusaka) was when I qualified to enter the University of Zambia. I am married and have two sons ages 9 and 2. My wife and I are expecting our third child. I have been running the business of Zoona cash transfers for a year. From the time I started, my biggest challenge has been to source working capital so that I can satisfy the customer demand, and expand my business. My business provides an essential service required for most livelihoods in a cheap and fast way. People come to my shop to send and receive money. This Kiva loan will help me realize my dream of expanding my Zoona cash transfer business in Chama district in the Eastern province. I will use the money to purchase a trading booth and use my capital to serve customers. My dream is to own a chain of Zoona mobile money transfer shops across the country, so that I can provide an essential service targeted at marketeers and people with no bank accounts. I am hopeful that having access to Kiva loans will make my dream a reality. Thank you.“

loans.use: to expand his Zoona mobile money transfer business by purchasing a new trading booth and increasing his working capital so he can serve more customers.

loans.name: Hajran

texts.en:
Hajran is a 42-year-old married woman. She has had a business of hand embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater for more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. 

Hajran dreams for her children's bright future and the well being of her family members.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 34 years old, a married woman and mother of two children. The man shown in the photo is Rukhsana’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Rukhsana has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for the vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. Rukhsana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is 35 years old and married. He supports five members of his family, including his children who are between 3 and 12 years old. He owns a retail shop in the Eldama Ravine location of Kenya. He has been in business for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 20,000.

He is now requesting his third loan of KES 120,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase stock of tea leaves, cooking fat, oil, sugar and rice among other stock. The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan and also to restock his shop.

His dream is to see his business expand and also to support his family well.

loans.use: To purchase stock.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia, a 59-year-old, widowed businesswoman in Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She earns a monthly income of KES 6,000, which she uses to support her family. This marks her second loan with KADET, after repaying her previous loan successfully. 

With the loan she has requested from KADET LTD, she will be able to purchase one-day-old chicks and chicken feed. The additional income she will earn will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family. In the future, Cicilia would like to expand her poultry farming and buy more livestock. 

She hopes to save enough money to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase one-day-old chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en:
Shahid is a 42-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 34 years old and she lives in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region. She lives with her father and brother; her mother unfortunately died several years ago. Naira’s elder brother lives in the Russian Federation and from time to time he sends some financial support to his family. Naira has studied at the Sevan Economics Technical school. Now she works as a secretary and, simultaneously is a student of the distance learning department at the Economics State University of Gavar branch. 

Naira mentions that she greatly wants to work in her area of specialisation and this is the reason that she combines her work and study. Besides these all she wishes a lot to buy a car for her own use. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams for that purchase and she hopes very much that in near future she will have a new job and go there with a new car.

loans.use: To buy a new car.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 48-year-old farmer, married to Peter who works in a quarry. They are blessed with three children.  Mary has been practicing farming for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 6,000 which she uses for the upkeep of her family. 

She is applying for her third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. She intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings etc. With the anticipated profit from her farm, she will purchase one-day-old chicks and animal feed. 

She hopes to improve the living standards of her family and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Iris Sobeida

texts.es:
Iris, estudio solamente hasta 2º grado, pues sus padres no contaban con los recursos, para brindarle el estudio, a eso, se le suma que la escuela donde debía asistir, estaba a casi 6 km de donde vivía, lo que hacia difícil el traslado de su casa a la escuela y viceversa. Y sus padres, no disponían de mucho tiempo para hacer el recorrido diario, por su trabajo, como jornaleros. Ella esta soltera, y en su casa, solo habita uno de sus cinco hijos, que estudia 2º año de bachillerato, los demás están casados y tienen otro lugar de residencia. 

Ella se dedica a trabajar con bovinos, específicamente, al engorde de estos para venderlos al termino de un año. Tiene casi 20 años de experiencia, oficio que aprendió de sus padres, quienes eran agricultores y pequeños ganaderos, y ella no a perdiendo la tradición. Recorre una distancia a pie, de 4 km junto con los animales, para llevarlos al potrero a las 6 de la mañana, y regresa por ellos a las 4 pm, para llevarlos a su casa, ella lo hace de lunes a viernes, y su hijo le ayuda sábado y domingo.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar ganado. Debido a una enfermedad que padeció ella, se vio en la necesidad de vender sus animales, para cubrir los gastos médicos durante su tratamiento. Por esa razón, desea volver a recuperarse y trabajar como siempre lo ha hecho.

Su sueño, es ayudar a su hijo, para que estudie una carrera universitaria, y verlo graduado como profesional, en el área que él decida. También, con la ayuda que se le a proporcionado, comprara ganado, lo engordara y lo venderá, con esos ingresos cancelara el crédito, y el resto le ayudara, a seguir invirtiéndolo, en la compra de mas ganado.
texts.en:
Iris only went to school up to the 2nd grade because her parents didn't have the resources to offer her an education. She adds that the school she was supposed to go to was almost 6 km from where she lives, which made it difficult to get there from her house and vice versa. In addition, her parents didn't have a lot of time to make the daily trip because of their work as day laborers. She is single and only lives with one of her 5 children, who is in the second year of high school. The rest of married and live elsewhere. 

She works with cattle. Specifically, she fattens them up to sell at the end of the year. She has almost 20 years' experience, and she learned the trade from her parents. They were farmers and small ranchers and she hasn't lost the tradition. She walks 4 km with the animals to take them to the pasture at 6 in the morning, and returns for them at 4 p.m. to take them home. She does this Monday through Friday, and her son helps her Saturday and Sunday. 

Her loan will be used to buy cattle. Due to an illness she suffered, she had to sell her animals to cover her medical costs during her treatment. For that reason, she wants to recuperate and work, as she has always done.

Her dream is to help her son so that he can go to college and see him graduate with whatever major he decides. Also, with the help that has been given to her, she will buy cattle, fatten them and sell them. With this income she will pay off the debt and the rest will help her keep investing in buying more cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is aged 45 and is married with six children aged 18, 16, 14, 12, 10 and eight. Five of his children attend school and he is in charge of paying their school fees. Fred's main source of income is an agriculture business which he has been doing since 2005, to support his family.

Fred previously took a loan of UGX 1,500,000 so that he could improve his agriculture business and as a result of this loan, Fred's output greatly increased. He now wants another loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy maize so he can have more output now that the season is on.

Fred's dream is to buy a vehicle to help him transport the agricultural output from his farms to different customers. However, he faces challenges like seasonality and competition. He has additional income which comes from motorcycles but this business also faces mechanical breakdowns.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Melany

texts.es:
Rosa, vive en casa propia con su familia, su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos para la belleza de las damas, lo realiza de manera ambulante y le ayudan sus hijos. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar variedad de mercadería, tales como: ropa interior para damas y caballeros, asimismo para niños, también cosméticos, tales como: polvos, maquillaje, lápiz labial, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a ofrecerle mayores productos a sus clientes, uno de los riesgos seria  que le roben aunque ella es muy conocida en la zona. 
Su sueño es adquirir un negocio grande para poder tener un local y no salir a lugares lejanos a ofrecer la mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in her own home with her family, her husband and three children. She sells clothes and cosmetics for women. She does it as a street vendor and her children help her. 
 
The loan she needs will allow her to buy a variety of merchandise such as: underwear for men, women and children, cosmetics such as powders, makeup, lipstick and more. This investment will help her to offer more products to her customers. One of the risks would be that she could be robbed, although she is very well known in the area. 

Her dream is to acquire a big business to be able to have a locale and not go to far away places to offer her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's and children's underwear, powders, makeup, lipstick and more.

loans.name: Oscar Réne

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre de 41 años de edad, es soltero. Estudio hasta noveno grado en la ciudad.  Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a sus padres que dependen de las actividades que él realiza.

Trabaja en  la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres; para llegar a la parcelas camina 2 Km  y trabaja junto a ellos durante la mañana y luego en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a cuidar ganado  en una hacienda.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca. Con el propósito de obtener más  leche y poderla vender a sus vecinos. Su deseo es, adquirir más animales para procesar la leche y vender lácteos.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 41 year old man. He is single. He went to school up to the ninth grade in the city. He gets up at 5:00 a.m. with his parents, who depend on the activities that he does. 

He works in agriculture, a trade he learned from his parents. To get to his land he walks 2 km and works with them in the morning and later in the afternoon he works caring for cattle at a farm.

The loan he is asking for is to buy a cow to obtain more milk and sell it to his neighbors. He wants to acquire more animals to process the milk and sell dairy products.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Yei

texts.en:
Yei is 37 years old, and lives in Sanniquille the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia.

She did not go to school. She is traditionally married, and her husband is a farmer. Together they have six children between 12 and 23. She said two of her children are in school, and they all live at home. 

By selling her husband’s farm products, she was able to establish her business. For ten years now she has been running a small local shop where she sells fashion slippers. She spends ten hours in her business, from Monday to Saturday. One of the problems she faces is her small income. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion slippers for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 42 years old, and lives in Sanniquille the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

She did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in Sanniqulle. She is traditionally married, and her husband is a farmer. Together they have four children between two and 27. She said only one of her children is in school, and they all live in the same house which was built by her children’s father.

With a little money from her husband; she was able to establish her table business. It has now been running for ten years and she sells palm oil, and oil. She spends eight hours a day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. 

One of the problems that she faces is her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
José cuenta con 36 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º grado, esta acompañado, su  pareja trabaja como jornalera en los cañales.   Han procreado dos hijos, ambos estudian en la escuela, que esta ubicada en el cantón de la comunidad.


Él trabaja como vigilante en los cañales, desde aproximadamente 5 años. También, es agricultor desde hace unos 10 años, oficios que aprendió de su padre, quien ha sido agricultor, toda su vida. Para llegar a los cañales, viaja 3 km en bicicleta desde su casa , su horario de trabajo es un turno diurno de 7 am a 4 pm, y uno nocturno de 5 pm a 6 am. Su trabajo de sembrar maíz, lo realiza los días de descanso.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Asegurando el alimento para el próximo año de su familia, y la producción restante, sera vendida para cancelar el crédito y seguir teniendo abiertas las puertas a futuros créditos.

Su sueño es,  mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, también con las ganancias obtenidas de la producción, tiene pensado iniciarse en el negocio del ganado, para eso comprara 2 terneros, los cuales criara y engordara para venderlos. Y en el caso de sus hijos, desea ayudarles para que estudien y puedan prepararse profesionalmente. Para todo esto, sabe que podrá lograrlo, solamente si continua trabajando fuertemente, como hasta hoy lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old. He studied until sixth grade. He is in a relationship, his partner works as a day laborer in the cane fields. They have two children together, who go to a school in a nearby canton.

José has worked as a security guard in the cane fields for approximately five years. He has also worked in agriculture for about ten years. He was taught by his father, who has worked in this his whole life. In order to reach the fields, he must ride his bicycle 3 km from home. He works different shifts, 7 am to 4 pm or 5 pm to 6 am. He works growing corn the days he is off work.

José is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides to plant corn in a 7,000-m2 piece of land. This way he will guarantee food for his family next year. He will sell what’s left in order to pay the loan back and keep the doors open for future loans.

His dream is to make some improvements to his house. Also, with the profits from his business, he is thinking of investing in cattle. He will buy two calves, fatten them and sell them. Regarding his children, he wants to help them so that they can study and become professionals. He knows he will reach his goals only if he continues to work hard, as he has so far.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides to plant corn in a 7,000-m2 piece of land.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
