Rabia is a 23-year-old single lady running a small general store in her community. She is motivated to provide all facilities of life to her family. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she requested a loan for PKR 20,000 which she will use to buy packs of biscuits, milk and beverages from the market at lower rates. With the help of this loan, she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her clients to generate more revenue. Rabia wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, milk and beverages.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su familia, su esposo y una hija. Ella, se dedica a la venta de lácteos y pollo, asimismo verduras, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace varios atrás y maneja su negocio con la ayuda de su familia. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar variedad de mercadería, tales como: queso, cuajada, crema, pollo y verduras. Esta inversión le ayudara a surtir su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias por el aumento de las ventas.
Su sueño es mantener su negocio y hacerlo crecer, ya que es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and her daughter.  She works selling dairy products, chicken, and vegetables.  She has been doing this work for many years and manages the business with the help of her family.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase a variety of merchandise such as cheese, curds, cream, chicken, and vegetables.  This investment will help her stock her business and be able to earn more profits with the increase in sales.  

Her dream is to maintain her business and make it grow, since it is her source of income.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, curds, cream, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Doña Sonia es una madre soltera, ella ha luchado toda su vida para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. ella ha salido adelante a con su hijos a pesar de estar sola. asi logró empezar a construir el hogar de su familia. ella necesita comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, cerámica entre otras para terminar su casa, por lo que necesitaría un préstamo de quinientos cincuenta mil colones (550.000) para terminar la construcción y así poder tener un hogar lleno de felicidad.
texts.en:
Sonia is a single mother who has fought for her whole life to be able to give her family a better quality of life.  She has moved forward with her children in spite of being alone.  She was able to start building a home for her family.  

She needs to purchase construction supplies such as cement, ceramic tiles, and others to finish her home, so she is requesting a loan of 550 colones to finish the construction so that she can have a home filled with happiness.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es:
Raúl, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en la tienda y panadería; esta compra le ayudara a adquirir harina, golosinas, bebidas, verduras, maíz, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió mejorar el negocio y aumentar su clientela, es por ello que aumentaron sus ventas. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Raúl saw the need to request a new loan, since he needs more working capital to continue investing in his store and bakery.  This loan will help him purchase flour, sweets, drinks, vegetables, corn, and other items.

His last loan allowed him to improve his business and expand his customer base, which increased his sales.  The financial conditions and circumstances of his family have improved.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sweets, drinks, vegetables, corn, and other items.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, where living conditions are much better than in the capital of Liberia. Nimba County is rich in natural resources and the second most populace county in Liberia.

Oretha is 30 years old. She did not go to school, and she is unmarried. She has a six-year-old child who attends school and lives at home. Oretha established her business with a little money from her fiancée. She said, "I learned this local business from my friends." Presently she runs a cook shop (restaurant) selling rice and dough made of cassava. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending ten hours at her business. A problem she faces is that she does not have enough dry-meat, fish, rice, cassava, etc. in stock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock for her business. Her plan is to one day build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena  de 65  años de edad es soltera no  tiene hijos   que dependen de ella y vive en la comunidad San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 19 Años  a la venta de tortillas. 
Doña Magdalena su venta es de forma ambulante en el mercado de San Lorenzo y también vende en su casa, es una mujer trabajadora y sola que ha luchado toda su vida para crecer a sus hijos.
Doña Magdalena está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña y cal.  Con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida. Su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener salud es un cliente muy responsable para Prisma.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 65 years old, single, and has no children that depend on her.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in a valley in the south of Honduras.  She owns the house she lives in.  She has worked for 19 years selling tortillas.

Magdalena sells on the street at the market in San Lorenzo, and also sells from her home.  She is a hardworking woman and has fought all of her life to raise her children.

She is requesting this loan to purchase corn, firewood, and lime.  With the support of the loan, she hopes to improve her income and therefore her quality of life.  Her dream is to improve her home and have good health.  She is a very responsible client for Prisma.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Joni

texts.en:
Joni lives in Serang, an semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Joni is married and living with three persons in the family home. 

Joni runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits.

Joni began working with Ruma eight months ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months, he has made around $48 to $50 in mobile phone airtime credit sales on average. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is a 48-year-old man from Olomasani located in Kenya. He supports eight people in his family and is a married man. He has eight children, whose ages range from 18 to 1 years old.

Johana is a farmer who keeps poultry for egg production and sells them to the nearby community. He has been doing this for the last seven years and gets a monthly income of KES 4,000. Johana has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy chickens for egg production. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business.

His dream is to promote his business and to improve the living standard of his family and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to produce eggs.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as aggressive and business focused. She operates a grocery business where she sells mangoes, tomatoes and other items. She will use the KES 6,900 loan to buy a solar lamp that will benefit five family members. 

Violet hopes that in the future, she will excel in business and have financial freedom.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth materials, threads, elastic lining, zippers, and some spare parts for her sewing machine

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon  is 23 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Sharon  has been working hard to manage her small store, which sells vegetables and fruits. 

To help expand her business, Sharon has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase onions and tomatoes to sell, and it will help Sharon  to generate greater profits and to expand her business. 

Sharon hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her capital. 

Sharon is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Berhanen

texts.en:
Berhanen lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about 90 minutes from Jakarta. Berhanen is married and living with three persons in the family home. 

Berhanen runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Berhanen began working with Ruma two years ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last month he has made around $150 to $152 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 34-year-old lady from Kakamega, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports four people in her house. She is married to Mr. Bernard who is also a businessman and supports the family by providing income. She has two kids who are eight and six years old.

Jean has a boutique salon within Kakamega town and has been doing this business for the past three years and generates a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more cosmetic products. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to grow the business into a big one.

loans.use: to purchase more boutique products.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris, 43 years old, lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions are much better than those in the capital city of Liberia, and it has the second largest population in Liberia. 


Doris, who did not go to school, is married to a carpenter, and they have seven children, two of whom are in school and live at home. She received a small amount of money from her husband to establish her business, a small shop selling palm oil, rice, vita, salt, bitter ball, etc, In business for seven years, she  spends 10 hours per day working from Monday to Saturday. Her main problem is a small income.


Doris is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, vita, salt, bitter ball, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, vita, salt, bitter ball, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Andi

texts.en:
Andi lives in Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Andi manages a small shop selling phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Andi is single.

Andi joined Ruma a month ago because he finds it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Andi has seen improvements in his shop. For the last a month, he earned $35 to $37 in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. His goal for his business is to expand to more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Jiguiseme Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe JIGUISEME IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOURO VILLAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme ASSANATOU debout en première position de la  droite vers la  gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 105.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "JIGUISEME IV" are married women, who average 42 years of age and six children each, all living in polygamous families in KOURO VILLAGE, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Ms. ASSANATOU, who is standing first from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women at the village, in SIKASSO.

She plans on making a profit of 105,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Keur Bakar Group

texts.fr: Ce  groupe est composé de 9 femmes qui habitent le même village et font toutes le commerce. Elle on une bonne cohésion sociale. Astou est la représentante du groupe, elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon de 5 ans et d'une fille de 2 ans Scolarisés.Elle fait du commerce de fruits et légumes et à une expérience de 4 ans . Elle part dans tous les marché hebdomadaires des villes environnants pour vendre sa marchandise.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 80 paniers de mangues à 240000f .Elle ne trouve pas de difficultés à écouler sa marchandise car elle a une bonne clientèle.Avec ses bénéfices elle aide son marie dans les dépenses domestiques et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group is composed of nine women who lives in the same village. They all work in commerce and have good social cohesion. Astou is the group's representative. She is a married mother of a 5-year-old boy and a 2-year-old girl, both in school. Astou does commerce in fruit & vegetables and has four years of experience. She goes around to all the weekly market in surrounding towns to sell her merchandise. With her loan, she intends to purchase 80 baskets of mangoes at 240,000 francs. She finds it's not hard to sell her merchandise because she has a good customer base. With the profits, she helps her husband to cover household expenses and the children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to pay for mangoes and transportation

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is 35 years old. He is married and has two children (a daughter and a son). He has a higher education in ecology, but now he is engaged in farming and agriculture. 

In his farm he is raising six cows, five heifers. Igor’s father, who simultaneously works as the chief veterinarian of their village, helps him greatly. They also cultivate some vegetables for their family use. Some part of hay for his farm cattle Igor buys from the villagers and the other part he mows himself. Igor has many plans connected with the enlargement of both his farm and farm cattle. He plans to build a barn for the cattle.

He asks a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams to start the building activities in order keep his farm cattle safe during winter months.

loans.use: To start the building activities in order keep his farm cattle safe during winter months.

loans.name: Migina Tukore Hamwe Group

texts.en:
Grace is a member of Migina Tukore Group and has borrowed from UGAFODE Microfinance twice. She is age 58 and is still ready to work to achieve her target in life. She is a business woman dealing in trade in bananas which she has done since 2008. She is a mother of four and began the business to be able to earn a living.

Grace gives the business an average of seven hours per day. She also has additional income from produce business which she started to have additional income. She does the banana trade business in her local cell and her major clients are both the rural people and the urban people. Grace applied for 500,000 UGX to be able to buy more produce so that she can have more income and hence more profits which will help her cater to her family's needs. Her major challenge is price fluctuation, which she says sometimes causes her losses. However, she believes that if she continues to be the goal-oriented person she has always been and gets loan funds from Ugafode, she will be at the same level with other people in her area.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Yuyun

texts.en:
Yuyun lives in Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Yuyun is married and has three children and five persons live in the family home.

Yuyun manages a small shop, selling groceries, snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credit. She joined Ruma two months ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Yuyun has seen improvements in her shop. For the last two months, she has earned an average of $29 to $31 in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. Her goal for her business is to expand to more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Ina

texts.en:
Ina lives in Bandung an semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Ina is married and living with three persons in the family home. 

Ina runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. She began working with Ruma three months ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. 

For the last month, she has made around $17 to $20 in sales of mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Jiguiseme Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe JIGUISEME II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOURO VILLAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme AMI debout en deuxième position de la  droite vers la  gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 95.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "JIGUISEME II" are married women, who average 42 years of age and six children each, all living in polygamous families in KOURO VILLAGE, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Ms. AMI, who is standing second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women at the village, in SIKASSO.

She plans on making a profit of 95,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Phiona's Group

texts.en:
Phiona's Group is comprised of two hardworking women. Phiona  is 16 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past one year, Phiona has been working hard to manage her small store, which sells cabbages and greens. 

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase matooke (green plantains) and sweet potatoes to sell, and will help Phiona to generate greater profits and to increase her capital. Phiona hopes that in the future, she will be able to accumulate more capital. 

Phiona is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase matooke (green plantains) and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Jiguiseme Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe JIGUISEME III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOURO VILLAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme  DJELIKA debout en première position de la  droite vers la  gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 95.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "JIGUISEME III" are married women, who average 42 years of age and six children each, all living in polygamous families in KOURO VILLAGE, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Ms. DJELIKA, who is standing first from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women at the village, at the market.

She plans on making a profit of 95,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a kind and hardworking person. His children are young and growing, and he is worried about their future. He is a poor person but loves his family very much. He tries to make sure that his family does not have any needs left, so that's why he continues with his carpentry work by day and night.

Amir is involved in his own business to have a regular income for the family. He is involved in the manufacturing and selling of furniture, such as tables, chairs, beds etc. He started this business over 11 years ago. His wife does not work; she stays at home and most of the days she gets sick. Today, he has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to expand his business. That is why he came to BRAC Pakistan and described his wish to obtain a loan to buy raw materials for marking furniture. He hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for his business as well as for his family.

Amir says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support

loans.use: To buy raw material for manufacturing furniture to sell.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Clarita is 57 years old and has one child who is in school.

Clarita has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Clarita requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc., for her business.

Clarita has been in this business for 42 years. Clarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc., for her business

loans.name: Clariza

texts.en:
Clariza is 48 years old and married with six children.

Clariza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Clariza has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Clariza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 57 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Elena is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been in pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig-raising business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Estrella has been in this business for 4 years. Estrella earns more income from a general store.

Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Jiguiseme I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JIGUISEME I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOURO VILLAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme FATOUMATA debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 90.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "JIGUISEME I" are married women, who average 42 years of age and six children each, all living in polygamous families in KOURO VILLAGE, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Ms. FATOUMATA, who is standing first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women at the village, in SIKASSO.

She plans on making a profit of 90,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 60 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more goods like shampoo, sugar, cereals, soft drinks, detergent soap and other goods to sell in her general store.

Gloria has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, cereals, soft drinks, detergent soap and other goods. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like shampoo, sugar, cereals, soft drinks, detergent soap and other goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yasri

texts.en:
Yasri lives in Tangerang, about two hours from Jakarta.  Yasri is married and has four children. Six persons live in the family home.

Yasri manages a small shop selling groceries and mobile phone airtime credit. He joined Ruma three months ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Yasri has seen improvements in his shop. For the last three months, he has earned an average of $87 to $90 in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. His goal for his business is to expand and to do more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is 43 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital City of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and has living conditions much better than in the capital city. It is the second most populated county in Liberia. She did not attend school, and she has lived all her life in rural areas. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. They have five children. Her children are between 12 and 16 years old. 

With a little money she received from her mother, she was able to establish her business. For 12 years she has been running a cook shop (local restaurant), where she sells rice and soup. She spends nine hours on her business and faces no problems except fewer goods in stock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice,  palm oil, vita, pepper meat, fish, etc., for her business. 

Her plan is to one day move from cook shop business to a modern restaurant business. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, and vita, pepper meat, fish, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Vigen

texts.en: Vigen lives in the city of Kapan with his wife and two children, both of whom are students. Vigen studied geology at the Polytechnic Institute, but now he has his own business, unrelated to his studies.  For eight years he has been engaged in trading fresh fish, and recently he managed to buy space so he can work without paying rent. Vigen has great variety of fish, which he buys from fishermen at  the Kapan and Kajran wholesale markets, where they bring live and fresh fish. Vigen has some new plans for enlarging his business. He is applying for a loan of 1,100,000 AMD (Armenian drams) to open a public food preparation point right in his shop, making us of the perfect assortment of fish that he sells in his shop.

loans.use: to open a public food preparation point right in his shop, with the perfect assortment of fish that he sells in his shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 50 year old, and she lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources, has living conditions that are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and is the second-largest populated county in Liberia. She was unlucky and did not attend school. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. They have three children. Her children are between 19 and 28 years old. Only one of her children is in school, and two of them live at home. 

Esther received a small amount of money from her husband to establish her business five years ago. She spends 10 hours on her business from Monday to Saturday. Some problem she faces is her small income. She will use the loan to purchase more dry fish for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank and pipes.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with five children between the ages of 3 months and 16 years. She began this business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income for her living.

Kadiatu runs a general store; she sells brooms, limes and charcoal. She has been running this business since five years ago. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day.  She says that her business is doing well, because out of the profit, she is able to take care of herself and her children.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as brooms, limes, charcoal and palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and change her family's status of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as brooms, limes, charcoal and palm oil.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 3 years and 13 years. She began this business because she wants to create a permanent source of income.

Fatmata runs a retail business; she sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap. She has been running this business since 1 year ago. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. She says that the main challenge of her business is price inflation.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as onions, peppers, biscuits and milk. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her installment and change her family's status of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as onions, peppers, biscuits and milk.

loans.name: Bomporo

texts.en:
Meet 44-year-old Bomporo from Waterloo western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 11 years and 32 years old. Her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Bomporo established her retail business. She started her business because she needs to earn income to support her home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of capital to run her business.

Bomporo requires a loan to buy palm oil and soap to prepare her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. Bomporo plans to expand her business more in the future. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and soap to prepare her business.

loans.name: Blelia

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Blelia from Liberia; precisely, she lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources, has living conditions that are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and is the second-largest populated county in Liberia.
 
Blelia is one of those who grew up in the rural areas of Sanniquelle, where she did not have the opportunity to attend school. Traditionally, Blelia is married, and her husband is a farmer. They have five children whose ages are between 20 and 30. Her children are all living on their own. 

With sales from her husband's farm products, she managed to establish this business. Over the past five years, she has been selling local soap.  She spends eight hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. Some problem she faces is her small income. She will use the loan to purchase more soap, palm oil, caustic, etc., for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, palm oil, caustic, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Marion from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children, ages 5 years and 10 years. She began this business because she wanted to contribute in supporting the home.

Marion runs a general store; she sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and phone credits. She has been running this business since four years ago. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day.  She says that the main challenge to her business is that during rainy season, she usually has difficulty to send a phone credit like Airtel.

Marion has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and change her family's status of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap.

loans.name: Haron

texts.en: Haron is a 26-year-old single man. He describes himself as a quiet person. He operates a shop where he sells vehicle spare parts. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are local customers. He will use the KES 63,000 loan to add the his stock of spare parts for resale, and to buy a solar panel to light his house. His business goal is to expand within five years. Previously he was a mechanic. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: add to his stock of spare parts for resale and to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo Western, a rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children, whose ages are 2 and 14. She began this business because she wants to educate her children. In 2010, Kadiatu established her retail business. She works 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Kadiatu requests a loan in order to buy more clothing material and slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and also have a permanent business location. In the future, Kadiatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material and slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro has a small farm in the state of Morelos and is constantly looking to reduce his operating costs. Through the acquisition of his 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will be able to displace non-renewable and fossil-fuel based liquefied petroleum gas and agrochemical fertilizer on his farm in favor of renewable biogas and biofertilizer generated from the abundant animal waste on-site. This loan represents 13% of the total price of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Zainab from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is single with 1 child age 6 years. She began this business because she dropped out from school and she needed to create income to support herself. In 2010, Zainab established her slippers business. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge of her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and try to attend a vocational school. In the future, Zainab plans to become a hairdresser. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: M. Shahid

texts.en: Shahid owns an auto electrical goods shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, and lives near his shop. His shop is situated in the vehicle spare parts market, and it is challenging for him to sell his products, given the presence of competitors. This competition has a strong effect on his daily sales. To grow his business and his income and to get away from the competitors, he thought of a plan or offering auto rickshaw spare parts. In his area, most of the people drive auto rickshaws professionally. Shahid hopes that this strategy will work positively and that his sales will develop. He cannot act on his strategy without some capital. He tried to take out a loan from banks and other organizations, but they refused to give him a loan. So he applied to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan, because BRAC Pakistan provides a loan facility to empower the poor. Shahid is married. He has to look after his young children and his old parents, but he hardly spends time with them due to his busy schedule. Shahid is stress-free after taking out the loan, because the BRAC has showed him a beam of hope in the darkness. He is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for auto rickshaws to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Hafeez

texts.en:
Hafeez is a 47-year old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been selling vehicle bearings since 1993. He buys steel bearings from the market in large quantities from a wholesaler at a low price, then sells it at a higher price as a retailer. He buys good quality bearings because he does not want to lose his reputation in the market.

He is the father of seven children; it is very difficult to afford the educational expense and household expenses as well. He is doing his best to fulfill all the needs of his family members. 

He wants to prove himself a successful father; he is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. He needs to earn additional income to support his family well. He is in his second loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan; he has been investing his previous loan in the same business. 

Currently he has requested a loan to buy more bearings so that he could increase his sales. He expects a boost in his earnings, and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of his business.

Hafeez is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy bearings to sell.

loans.name: Safina's Group

texts.en: Safina's group is composed of two hard-working women. Safina is 23 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past four years , Safina has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. To help expand her business, Safina has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy clothes, and it will help Safina to generate greater profits and increase on the income. Safina hopes that, in the future, she will be able to increase her capital. Safina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for training in life-skills.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell in her boutique.

loans.name: Yainkain

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Yainkain from the eastern Waterloo area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 12. 

Yainkain runs a general store; she sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and soap. She has been running this business for three years. She began this business because she wants to create a permanent source of income. She works at the business every day, 12 hours a day.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Yainkain has requested a loan to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her installment and change her family's status of living. 

In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and soap.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 12 and 22 years. Her children are currently attending school. For the past 15 years, Mariatu has been running her established stationary business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge for her business lack of enough capital to run her business.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to books, pens, pencil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, Mariatu plans to own a big stationary shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy books, pens, pencils to expand her business.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en: Anabel is 31 years old, married, and has four children. Anabel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store, including canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil and noodles. Anabel has borrowed and repaid seven NWTF loans before this loan. She has been running the store for 10 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling bananas. Anabel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store, including canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil and noodles.

loans.name: Abdul Rashid

texts.en: Abdul Rashid is a young, kind, 33 year-old man. He is married and has a son and daughter. He is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He tries to make sure that all his family’s needs are met. He is involved in his own business, to earn a regular income for the family. He manufactures and sells furniture, including single beds, sofas, chairs and tables. He started this business over 10 years ago. His wife does not work; she stays at home and looks after his son and old parents. Because his children are still very young, his children and the old parents need good care. Today, he has many regular customers, and he also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for Abdul Rashid, but his family's needs are increasing day by day, and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture, in order to expand his business. This is why he came to Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan and wants to obtain a loan from to buy raw materials. He hopes this loan will prove beneficial and productive for his business and as for his family. Abdul Rashid says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 35 years old, a farmer, and single. She has been farming for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses for her up-keep and that of her parents. Mercy is applying for her third loan term from KADET, after repaying her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting. With the anticipated profits from her farm, she will start to engage in large-scale farming. Her hopes and dreams are to export her farm produce to other countries.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is single with 1 child, age 5 months. She began this business because she wants to create income to support herself and her child. In 2010, Mariatu established her slippers business. She works at the business 11 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to buy more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and try to attend a vocational school. In the future, Mariatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Eletha

texts.en: Eletha is 34 years old and lives in Ganta. She’s married, and her husband is not working at this time. They have a 13-year-old child. They all live at home, and the child attends school. For twelve years, Eletha has been operating a table where she sells plantains and red oil rice. Interestingly, she has many customers, since her business is in a very good location. Eletha is applying for a loan to buy plantains and red oil for her business. She plans to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy plantains and red oil for her business.

loans.name: Augusto  Cesar

texts.es: El señor Augusto se dedica a la actividad de prestar servicios de imprenta en lo que impresiones de tarjetas de cumpleaños, bodas, quince años, emplasticado, encolochado etc, tiene 9 años de prestar estos servicios a la comunidad, el señor Augusto trabaja de lunes a sabado en su pequeña empresa tiene 4 trabajadores quienes le ayudan a sacar el trabaja en tiempo y forma, es soltera tiene una niña que depende  de el esta en edad escolar y es la razon por la que lucha para sacarla adelante. el señor solicita el financiaminto para invertir en su negocio, nesecita comprar papeleria para tarjetas.
texts.en: Augusto works for a printing business, printing cards for birthdays, weddings and quinceañeras, offering laminating and binding services etc. He has 9 years' experience bringing these services to his community. Augusto works from Monday to Saturday at his small business. He has 4 employees who help him complete the work on time. He is single and has a school-age daughter who is his dependent, and he works hard to provide for her. Augusto is asking for a loan to invest in his business, as he needs to buy paper to make cards.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink, toner.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Bacilia is a member of the group called Fuente para el desarrollo (Development source), located in the city of Samana. This is her eleventh loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had his business for over six years, she started it with her first Esperanza International loan. 

After her last loan, which she invested in her business, Bacilia realized the need to build an extra room for her kitchen. With this housing loan she is able to take, and with her business profits, she can pay for it and save for more home improvements. The other members of her group are recommending her for a housing loan to build this room to expand her house with more spaces. With this loan she will be able to buy construction materials like concrete blocks, rods, cement, zinc for the roof, and other supplies.

Esperanza International runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings. Bacilia lives together with her long-term partner and their five children. She is also a micro-entrepreneur conducting a Comedor (a place were she sells fried food, like fish). She thanks God, Esperanza International and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy concrete blocks, cement, rods, and other supplies.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.en:
Nidia is one of Esperanza International Dominican Republic's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza International Dominican Republic almost five years ago, for a loan to expand her business. She joined the group, Las Vecinas (neighbors), in one of the rural villages in Samana. She has received ten loans to invest in her business, selling jewels. 

Esperanza International Dominican Republic is running a program in which most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity to their groups. They can request loans to improve their houses, while running their businesses, and attending group meetings.

Nidia is a married woman, with three children.Years ago, she started building her house and now she is requesting a loan to have her house floor finished. With this loan, she will purchase cement, sand, and other building materials to make the floor and she will also pay for the building labor. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and other building materials.

loans.name: Pedro David

texts.es:
Pedro es un joven originario de linda ciudad de Estelí que se encuentra ubicada en la parte norte de Nicaragua, estado civil de Pedro es acompañado, edad 26 años y tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Se identifica por ser un varón de mucho trabajo y sobre todo  responsable.

Es el crédito número 4 y manifiesta que han sido de gran importancia en su familia porque ha resuelto algunas necesidades del hogar.
Su oficio es albañil y trabaja para una empresa de construcción desde hace varios años.

Con el monto financiado lo va destinar para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como piedra cantera, arena, hierro y cemento ya que necesita construir un muro de cerco de su vivienda.
Ala misma vez agradece a kiva por el apoyo brindado ya que de esta manera podrá dar una mejor seguridad a su vivienda y así evitar que los ladrones se le introduzcan en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Pedro, 26, is a young man from the beautiful city of Estelí, which is located in Northern Nicaragua. He is in a relationship and has a child that goes to school. He is known to be a hardworking and responsible man.

This is his fourth loan and he says that the previous ones have been of great importance for his family, since they have helped them cover their needs. He is a mason and has worked for a construction company for some years. He will use the loan to buy construction materials such as gravel, sand, iron and cement. He needs to build a wall to protect his house.

He wants to thank Kiva for the support he has received. With it, he will have a safer house and will protect it against thieves thinking to trespass.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, iron, cement and gravel.

loans.name: Bernarda De Lourdes

texts.es: la señora Bernarda Habita en una comunidad de chinandega desde hace 15 años, ahi tiene una pequeña pulperia que es con la que sale adelante para el sustento de su hijo un joven con discapacidad que depende de ella, ella a la vez se ayuda con otro ingreso realiza almuerzos para mejorar sus ingresos, trabaja de lunes a domingo,  es madre soltera  es una señora esforzada , solicita el financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio ya que es el unico ingresos con el que cuenta para ella y para su hijo.
texts.en: Bernarda has been living in a community in Chinandega for 15 years.  There she has a small grocery store which is helping her to get ahead and to support her disabled son.  As well as the grocery store, Bernarda prepares lunches in order to improve her income.  She works seven days per week. She is a single mother and a strong woman.  Bernarnda is applying for this loan to invest in her business, as this is the only source of income she has to support  herself and her son.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, biscuits, sweets, coffee, soup, eggs and trinkets.

loans.name: Generación 2013 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GENERACIÓN 2013”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de deportivos, trabajo de carpintería, venta de comida, venta de chocolates, venta de máznelos, venta de CD’s, venta de vajillas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elena es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de deportivos; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de su cuñada, quien realiza los deportivos y ella los comercializa por menor.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de deportivos) que adquirirá de su cuñada que es mayorista y posteriormente a la lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Generación 2013” is set to begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Elena is president. The businesses that the members carry out are varied. Among them are: the sale of sportswear, carpentry work, food sales, chocolate sales, marshmallow sales, CD sales, and glassware sales.

The loan that they take out will benefit smalltime entrepreneurs, one of whom is Elena. Elena says that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago, due to an invitation from her sister-in-law, who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling sportswear. She says that she launched this business on the recommendation of her sister-in-law, who works in sportswear; Elena sells the sportswear on a retail basis.

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital (the purchase of sportswear).  She will get the sportswear from her sister-in-law, who is a wholesale supplier, and then will sell them in her sales space. This method of work permits her to generate income to keep up her home, as she is married with two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the area of health.

loans.use: to purchase sportswear

loans.name: David

texts.es: David, de 36 años de edad, está casado con Evila y junto a  ella tiene 04 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. David se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte a pasajeros en su mototaxi, el cual se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros. Anteriormente trabajaba como chofer de otro motocarro pero desde hace 1 año tiene su mototaxi propio y trabaja cómodamente, sin embargo la calidad de su vehiculo no es el ideal ya que lo compró usado y requiere ciertas reparaciones. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos familiares. Se inició por la necesidad de contar con un trabajo propio ya que siempre le cerraban las puertas en locales donde se presentaba para trabajar y no podía conseguir un empleo estable. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado refaccionará su mototaxi comprando algunos repuestos y accesorios que necesita para continuar trabajando como espejo, llantas nuevas y tapizado.
texts.en: David is 36 and is married to Evila. Together they have four children with whom they live in their own house. David provides a transport service in his motorcycle taxi, which he bought with his savings. Previously he worked driving an auto-rickshaw but for the last year he has had his own mototaxi and now he can work comfortably. However, his vehicle is not the best quality as he bought it second hand, and it needs a number of repairs. He enjoys his work as it gives him an income which he can use to pay the household expenses. He started working as a driver because he needed to find work; he was always being turned down for jobs and couldn't find stable employment. On this occasion David is asking for a loan of 500 PEN. He is grateful for the financial support which will help him reach his goals. With the loan he has requested he will buy the parts and tools he needs to repair his mototaxi and continue working, such as mirrors, tyres and seat covers.

loans.use: to buy the parts and tools he needs to repair his mototaxi, such as mirrors, tyres and seat covers.

loans.name: Ngenth Case Foyer Group

texts.fr:
le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été créé le 01/12/2008. Il est composé de 3 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et font toutes le commerce,elles ont une bonne cohésion sociale. Mareme est la représentante du groupe et est placée à gauche de la photo avec une écharpe blanche. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 filles et trois garçons qui ont entre 34 et 19 ans.Elle fait du commerce de tissu et de meuble de maison.elle a une grande boutique au marché.Avec son prêt elle compte renforcer son stock en achetant un rouleau de tissu wax à 360000f.Elle travaille avec sa fille ainé qui part dans les autres pays pour acheter les tissu de bonne qualité.
Avec ses bénéfices elle Achète des terrain nues pour garder son argent;elle a acheter le billet de sa fille qui voyage pour faire du commerce;elle achète aussi des bijoux de valeur pour garder son argent.
texts.en:
This group is part of a Banc Villageois that was created 01/12/2008. It consists of three women who live in the same neighborhood, who practice commercial activities, and who share a good social bond. They are represented by Mareme, seen on the left in the photo and wearing a white scarf. 
Mareme is married with five children aged 19 to 34, two girls and three boys. She sells fabrics and home furniture, and she runs a large store at the market. 

Mareme plans to use her loan to bolster her stock by buying one bolt of wax fabric for 360,000f. She works with her eldest daughter who travels abroad to buy high-quality fabrics. 

Mareme uses her profits to buy undeveloped lands and expensive jewelry as a way of investing money, and she pays for her daughter’s fare when travelling on business.

loans.use: to buy one bolt of wax fabric for 360,000F.

loans.name: Mame Asta's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 2 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui font toutes le commerce. Mame Asta est la représentante du groupe et est placé a droite de la photo en teint claire,elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 5 scolarisée.Elle fait de l'aviculture dans sa maison. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 200 poussins à 98000,vaccin à 8000;aliments 12 sacs à 180000.Elle ne se plein pas pour ce qui est de la rentabilité de son activité.Avec ses bénéfices elle satisfait ses besoins personnels et celui de sa petite famille .Elle aide aussi son marie dans les dépenses domestiques.
texts.en: This group is composed of two female entrepreneurs living in the same neighborhood. Mame Asta, the group’s representative, is on the right in the photo wearing a light-colored outfit. She is married and has six children, five of whom are in school. She grows poultry at home. With her loan, she plans to buy 200 chicks for 98,000 West African francs, vaccines for 8000 francs, and 12 bags of fodder for 180,000 francs. She is satisfied with her business’ profitability. She uses her revenues to provide for her  personal needs and the needs of her small family. She also helps her husband with household expenses..

loans.use: to buy 200 chicks for 98,000 West African francs, vaccines for 8000 francs, and 12 bags of fodder for 180,000 francs.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Luis, a sus 29 años de edad, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 5 años. Actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio propio, un almacén donde ofrece lencería y pijamas. Esta idea de negocio surgió de la necesidad de conseguir recursos para el sostenimiento de su  familia, inicialmente se encontraba ubicado en un local arrendado, pero en vista del costo excesivo del arriendo, tuvo que trasladarse y, logró conseguir otro local mucho más central y el arriendo más económico, esto le dio la oportunidad de tener más capital disponible para invertirle a su negocio. El cliente trabaja en compañía de su esposa, todos los días de la semana de 9:00 am a 6:00 pm y, gracias al buen servicio que prestan y a la calidad de los productos que venden, han logrado ser reconocidos en el sector. Su espíritu emprendedor y su ganas de salir adelante lo motivaron a solicitar el crédito como apoyo, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (pijamas y lencería), además comprará el SOAT de su moto, la cual utiliza para prestar servicio de moto taxi; esto le permitirá tener más variedad de artículos, que satisfagan los gustos de sus clientes, además podrá incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Luis sueña con hacer crecer su negocio para que sea rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, que le brinde la capacidad de brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, 29 years old, lives with his wife and 5-year-old son. At present he has his own business, a store that sells lingerie and pajamas. This business idea came about from the need to obtain the resources necessary to support his family. Initially it was located in a leased space, but the cost of rent was unreasonable and he had to move. He was able to find another store space that was much more central with a lower rent cost. This gave him the opportunity to have more capital available to invest in his business. 

Luis works with his wife every day from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm. Thanks to the good service they provide and the quality of the products they sell, they have become recognized in the area. His enterprising spirit and desire to get ahead motivated him to seek the support of a loan, in order to invest it in the purchase of wholesale merchandise (pajamas and lingerie). He will also buy insurance for his motorbike, which he uses to provide taxi services. This will allow him to have a greater variety of things that satisfy the needs of his clients and he will be able to increase his sales and his income.

Luis dreams of seeing his business grow to become sustainable and profitable in time, affording him the ability to provide his family with a greater sense of well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (pajamas and lingerie) and purchase insurance for his motorbike.

loans.name: José German

texts.es:
José de 52 años de edad, es casado. empezó a trabajar la agricultura desde sus 16 años, cuidando animales y trabajado con su padre en la agricultura.

A los 25 años se caso y empezó a trabajar por su cuenta y en compañía de su esposa cultivaban poco; ya que no tenían las condiciones para hacerlo en mas cantidades de tierra, a medida paso el tiempo trabajaron mas.

Del matrimonio tuvieron 5 hijos están estudiando con mucho esfuerzo, en ocasiones lo apoyan en el trabajo agrícola; pero siempre tiene que pagar mosos para esta actividad.

Sus trabajos los realiza a un kilómetro de distancia de su casa , ya que en esa zona solo en los cerros se cultiva, tiene que madrugar para el trabajo para terminar al  medio día y  llegar a cuidar sus animales; ya que los tiene cerca de ese lugar y espera hasta llegar la tarde.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de insumos agrícolas; abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mosos  y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo de maíz y frijol. Espera para el futuro darles el estudio a sus hijos y trabajar a través de los créditos y lograr comprar un terreno para construir una vivienda para él y su familia.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old and married. He began to work in agriculture at 16 years old, caring for animals and working with his father in agriculture. At 25 years old, he got married and began to work on his own, and with his wife cultivated little since they did not have the conditions to do so in a larger area of land. So as time passed, they worked more. From the marriage, they had five children. The children are studying very hard. On occasion, they support him in his agricultural work, but he always has to pay farmhands for this activity.

He carries out his work a kilometer from his home, since one only cultivates crops on hills in this zone. He has to get up early for his work to finish at midday and to care for his animals since he has them close to his crops, and he waits until the afternoon arrives.

The loan funds will be used to buy agricultural supplies: compost, fertilizer, the payment of farmhands, and to prepare the earth for the cultivation of corn and beans. He hopes to provide an education to his children, work through the loans, and be able to buy land to construct a home for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, pay farmhands, and to prepare the earth for the cultivation of corn and beans.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Don  Víctor vive en casa propia con su hermano, él es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora con espíritu emprendedor  él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Víctor esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plaga, etc. y asi  realizar  como hasta ahora su trabajo y poder  mejorar  sus ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Victor lives in his own house with his brother.  Victor is very responsible and hard-working, and has an enterprising spirit.  Victor has been making a living in agriculture for a number of years and, with the money he makes from his sales, he is able to cover some household costs.  Victor is applying for a loan to buy herbicides, fertilisers, manure, anti-plague treatments and more.  With the loan, he will be able to continue with his work, improve his income and give his family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilisers, manure, anti-plague treatments and more.

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es: el señor Jose Noel tiene 28 años de tener su negocio de reparación de motores estacionarios,  su negocio lo empezó con capital propio, trabaja en una empresa como ayudante de mecánico de aviación y luego decidió poner su propio negocio. es casado tiene 4 hijos que dependen de el, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, presta servicios a todo el publico en general para obtener sus ingresos, solicita el financiamiento para comprar repuestos para su negocio y ofrecerles a sus clientes de una vez.
texts.en: José Noel is 28 years old and has a business repairing vehicles.  He started the business with his own capital.  Beforehand José worked for a company as an aviation mechanic's assistant and, later, he decided to set up his own business.  José is married and has four children who depend on him.  He works from Monday to Saturday, from 7am until 5pm.  He offers services to the general public in order to earn a living.  He is applying for a loan to buy spare parts for his business and to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his workshop.

loans.name: Kafoulaha  I Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe KAFOULAHA I sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à IFOLA, un des villages de la   3èmerégion administrative du Mali (Sikasso).
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.
Ils sont a leur cinquième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs, pour ABDRAMANE 1ère personne à droite de la  photo, avec son prêt, il compte acheter des engrais pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Farakala et à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement des hommes.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 500.000FCFA  en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Kafoulaha I group are married men averaging 40 years of age, with six children, and living in traditional families in Ifola, a village in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth agricultural loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid prior loans. The grow corn, which is the case of Abdramane, for example. He is the first one on the right in the photo. With this loan he plans to buy fertilizers for 3 ha [about 7.5 acres] of land.

After harvesting, he sells his produce in his village, in Farakala and in Sikasso, to a customer base composed of both men and women. He plans to  earn a revenue of 500,000 West African francs at the end of the agricultural campaign. This will allow him to pay off his loan and also help with everyday expenses for his large family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, de 51 años de edad, está casada con Tito, quien es obrero de construcción y padre de sus 02 queridos hijos, de 19 y 16 años de edad con quienes vive en su casa propia. Doris se dedica a la confección, cose prendas de vestir de diferentes variedades para todo tipo de ocasión, como polos, camisas, faldas, calzones y otros. Realiza su trabajo en su hogar ya que acondiciono un ambiente especialmente para la exhibición de sus trabajos terminados. Se inició en esta labor gracias a que estudió en un centro de educación ocupacional, invirtió su propio capital para pagar su matrícula, ella sabía que la inversión le daría muchas  satisfacciones. Esta actividad la viene realizando hace más de 06 años, tiempo que le sirvió para ser reconocida entre sus clientes por la calidad de sus prendas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará materiales de confección como telas, hilos, blondas entre otros.
texts.en:
Doris is 51 and married to Tito, a construction worker and the father of her two precious children, who are 19 and 16. The family lives in a home that Doris and Tito own. 

Doris works as a seamstress and makes clothing for all occasions, including polos and other shirts, dresses, shorts, and other garments. Doris works in a shop her home and has also set up a display area for her finished products. 

Doris became a seamstress after learning to sew at a job training center. She used her own funds to pay the tuition, knowing that her investment would  benefit her greatly. Doris has been making clothes for six years, and has gained a reputation among her clients for the quality of her work. She is applying for a loan of 1,000 soles, which she will use to purchase sewing materials such as fabric, thread, and lace. Doris is very grateful for the financial help that will allow her business to grow and is determined to make her loan payments promptly.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials, including fabric, thread, and lace.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She is a single woman. She lives together with her children. She is working hard to change her home structure, and with her husband, she has decided to take a loan with Esperanza to continue improving their house.

Maria has been taking loans with Esperanza Internacional since she started her business, with her first loan almost seven years ago. She is receiving her 13th loan and this one is to finish building her house. She will build some concrete block walls in her house. With this loan she will buy concrete blocks, cement, rods and other building materials. 

Maria is one of the members in the group called Nuestro Progreso (New Progress) located in one of the rural villages in the city of Samana. Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups.
